description:
I have to be honest with you and express that I had absolutely no expectations about Garibaldi's.  I was principally going to meet dear friends who had lost their beautiful home in the Sonoma fires; and were grateful to be alive.  
I had just returned from France and in the savory memory of an American ode to foie gras I decided to try their chicken liver pate.  It completely blew my mind, and I had to readjust my head because I was 'shook'.  Its that good.  So flavorful and rich, creamy smooth with a melody of high and low notes playing simultaneously on your palate.  It was the highest quality I've had anywhere--and so well done.  I would dare to say it was the best.  
Three of us ordered the Chicken Milanese with lemon caper beurre blanc and mashed potatoes.  Another complete and total winner.  Soulful, mouthwatering deliciousness.  The chicken was tender and impeccably cooked, the crunch contrasted with the smooth potatoes, perfectly balanced by the lemon caper beurre blanc.  There was nothing to say.
Complete satisfaction.  After that flawless apex I was not interested in any dessert.  Give yourself a treat and go.  If they had delivery I would be a junkie.
author: Portia S.

description:
This has a great neighborhood vibe. Very cool space and location. We also loved the wine list. Enjoyed a delicious Chardonnay!

We ordered the calamari and chicken Milanese which we knew was the house specialty. The calamari app was delicious!! It's a small serving but very flavorful. Unfortunately the chicken dish was woefully underwhelming to both of us. My husband described the flavor as very subtle which is spot on. It wasn't bad. It just wasn't anything special. 

Another unfortunate note is our waiter was pretty inattentive. We had to ask for bread. The $180 bottle
Of white wine was placed on the table to sweat (which it did). I requested a wine holder to keep the wine chilled but one never came. We v much felt like an afterthought. Oh well! I'm glad we tried this spot and if I lived here I'm
Sure I would go back again. But this is not a place to hit if you only have a few nights.
author: Jessica G.

description:
I had the best chicken Milanese of my life here, and I've been to Italy. But all the food I had here was delicious! 

For starters, I had the risotto croquettes, fried zucchini, and chicken pâté. For my main, I had the chicken Milanese, which came with a heaping arugula salad, and mashed potatoes. That plate was so perfectly balanced, and I ate every single morsel. And it was a huge portion!! For dessert, I had the chèvre cheesecake, and for those that don't know what chèvre is, it's goat cheese. You can definitely tell it's goat cheese, so only get it if you like that kind of cheese! 

The food here was amazing, so I will definitely be returning. But service was just ok. My waiter was forgetful.
author: Rachel H.

description:
FRAUD ALERT!!!!!!
If you pay via credit card keep your receipt and over the next week or so check your credit card account. Garibaldi's charged us the amount we authorized on our card for the appropriate date we came in. The next day they charged us again, but a higher amount. No good. At first glance, a simple mistake of a duplicate charge. I reported to my bank, but the restaurant only refunded the lower of the 2 amounts. The kept the fraudulent amount. Ok. Odd, but I can deal and take care of it. Called my bank again to request the signature sheet. Got my money corrected. Won't go back. 

Here's where it gets weird! Being this is a perfect neighborhood restaurant and I actually talk with my neighbors I found out that loads of people have had similar issues with this restaurant. False charges and the restaurant banking on people not actually checking what they spend. 

Great food. Worth a try, but terrible service. Just be sure to check what you are charged and when you go.
author: Kristi B.

description:
I reviewed this neighborhood gem in mid December 2017. Always like coming because it feels so cozy-- and well, it is given its size. So I won't go into all the things I wrote before. Rather this is an update.

Had a lovely window table for two - fun to see all the locals coming in on a Saturday night. Greeted warmly and seated on time. Cocktails ordered 
Including a brought a special bottle of wine from Alban Vineyards in Arroyo Grande ( Santa Barbara. Santa Ynez)....more on this later.

Waiter was pleasant and informed us he was new to Garabaldi's-- but had been a server a long time and he definitely wasn't a rookie. Ordered a split appetizer. Veggie dumplings and very tasty.

Next came the Chopped salad, not my favorite but wife loves it. So I had the most delicious cauliflower soup I have ever had. Simply amazing. Not a drop of cream in it. Just puréed cauliflower and broth drizzled with a little oil and a few tiny chips of cauliflower on top. Order it. $10. Worth every penny.

Next the mains-- I had grilled salmon (5 oz, maybe) cooked perfectly with a light brothy sauce. Enjoyed it, not a large dish at $34. Wife had Fresh pasta with rabbit sugo. Tasty, but...very dry. Our waiter never came back once as our food was brought to us by other servers. We couldn't flag down anyone. Frustrating and decided to let it go. 

After the dishes we cleared he finally came over ( my wife left to was her hands) and I mentioned to him we were disappointed he disappeared. I explained about the dish and he apologized. I simply tried to explain he needed to be attentive. Told me he had way too many tables. Not my issue.

For $200 without tip I felt it was a near miss. I like this place a lot. Hope it gets better.
author: Greg C.

description:
My husband and I have been coming to Garibaldi's for a few years now; we even celebrated here after we got married last April.

The service is always great, and the food is always good! 

Tonight the service was extra amazing the server recognized the fact that I was vegetarian and made sure to fill me in on what dishes had animal products in them.

We started with a salad which was very good. I had the gnocchi as my main dish, the sauce was extraordinary! My husband had the carbonara and he said that his was awesome! 

I have yet to have a bad experience at Garibaldi's and will continue to dine here whenever I have the chance.
author: Charles B.

description:
I hope the manager reads this.  I have been here several times before, always loved it, but this was by far the worst experience. You need serious training of your staff as to what kind of restaurant you are, and how patrons expect to be treated. I would expect a meal there to be a minimum of a 90 minute experience.
First, we made a reservation for 8:30 so we could watch the world series. We arrived around 8:35 and were seated right away. The waitress was basically in a hurry from that moment on.  She asked us for our order before even getting a drink order.  We were not ready. Then after taking the drink order, she came back for food order, again before bringing the drinks.  We weren't ready. After we got drinks, we ordered appetizers.  We had the pate' and the calamari. Both were quite good and the portion sizes were fine. 
We then ordered our main course. We had the chicken cutlet and the sea bass. The portion of sea bass was no more than 3 ounces.  It was embarrassing.  It was cooked fine and tasted fine but it was just way too small. the chicken was somewhat dry and and very pounded so it was too thin. She came back at least twice to hurry us a bit. My date even commented that they wanted us to finish. We decided not to have dessert.
I have always considered this a true romantic date restaurant, where you settle in and enjoy your evening. I may have to re-think that.  If you don't want people there after 9:30, then don't take 8:30 reservations, or better yet, open a restaurant in Kansas, not a major city.
author: Z A.

description: We came here for lunch and left very satisfied! I ordered the Grilled Cheese Sandwich, which came with jarlsberg, manchego, and "midnight moon" cheeses, a side of really delicious salad, and a cup of tomato soup, which was so delicious. Because of how much cheese was in the sandwich, I did feel full fast, so might even be a good option to split and then order another small plate or salad to share. My husband ordered the grilled chicken sandwich, and while I'm not a fan of chicken, I took a bite and thought it was delicious. They also have an extensive wine menu, but we ended up being so hungry when we got there that we jumped right into the food. Street parking in the area was very easy, and the atmosphere of this restaurant was very nice for lunch, and I imagine even nicer during dinner! I highly recommend this place!
author: Shobha K.

description: Lovely dinner at this restaurant. We had mussels with pasta, chicken Milanese and the homemade pasta. All meals were delicious. Our server was spot on and efficient. Nice atmosphere and lighting.
author: Puna S.

description:
We had a great dinner last night at Garibaldi's.  I ate here 15 years ago, when I lived in the East Bay.  We frequented Garibaldi's when they had their Rockridge location.  I've been back in SF for 7 years, will now frequent this location.  Dinner was excellent, great service from Jerimiah, fun atmosphere, nice wine list, made for a great dinner out.

I had the asparagus salad, the other 3 had delicious caesars.  I had the grilled calimari on a bed of white beans, was so good.  My husband loved the pasta dish, my sister said the muscles were really good, and her husband had, what he said, was the best roasted chicken.  All our dishes were really good.  Our server recommended both wines, we had an excellent white wine from Spain, and a really nice red wine from Italy.  Such a nice neighborhood restaurant, we will be going back soon.
author: Carole W.

description:
I went here last night with three others and I had an amazing experience! The food was incredible, the cocktails were amazing, and the service was fantastic. I love that it's a local, neighborhood restaurant with a great atmosphere. I had a cucumber martini, calamari for appetizer, and the pasta with sausages and veggies and have to say it all combined was one of the best meals I've had in SF.

Highly recommend!
author: Daniel C.

description:
Garibaldi's has been on our wish list of restaurants to check out for years now and our dinner club finally picked it a few months ago.  The wait staff was a bit stiff when we got there but they loosened up and we got to talking to our waiter Jeremiah who was amazing.  We had a large group so we ordered a lot of different food from the menu.  The highlights were the risotto croquettes and the tagliatelle for me.

For dessert we shared the budino, sorbet, profiteroles and banana pie and everything was delicious.  It was a great way to end a greta meal and experience.
author: Blake B.

description:
Finally home and recovering from our ski n skate week in SF
Memories include a wonderful meal at Garibaldi's
Great service, approachable wine list, and they were great with our kids (our kids are pretty restaurant-comfy as long as they have their phones)
Thanks for a nice evening!
author: Laketahoe G.

description: Nesteled in the heart of a classic SF neighborhood this quiet area seems like there is no restaurant, we all most  missed it. Found plenty of street parking (I was shocked) and walked in the very busy Garibaldis. The place is small but we had a table for 8. Our waiter friendly but a bit forgetful. He would walk back and forth  and not bring us bread or open my wine bottle (sigh) but the ambiance and low lighting made it good for conversations. We started with the calamari that is not fried and was cooked to perfection. The heirloom tomatoes another win. Patatas bravas not spicy but good. Service with the waiter was slow but the food came out quick and the expediter did a great job. We were there till they closed.
author: Theresa G.

description: This place was pretty elegant. We came here for lunch and the salad were very delicious. I wasn't a fan of the Moscow mules though.
author: Ruben V.

description: Great service however, Food wasn't anything special, nothing that stood out. Cocktails were gross, stick to the wine. I had a Masonic Mule and it was overpowered by lime juice, I had to send back. Environment was nice and our server was great, she was very attentive. Overall it's somewhere to try if you're in the area but I wouldn't return otherwise.
author: Steph A.

description:
We went as a big group to Garibaldi's over the Thanksgiving holiday weekend. My first time there with my wife.

Ambiance was nice upon arriving.  We ordered the Brussels Sprouts for appetizers which admittingly were good.

Unfortunately, nothing else went right and it was a disaster.  We tried ordering the gnocchi which was out.  We ordered a clam chowder soup which was way too salty and inedible. My sister's chicken salad was dry and the dressing was bland.

After dinner, we wanted to order dessert, the 'milk and cookies' this also was NOT available to order.

My wife happened to have a cookie we bought earlier in the day, and we put it on the table to share it and the server came by and said they would charge us for bringing the cookie in!!!! Something called a 'cakeage' fee like when you bring in wine for a Corking fee, except this was for dessert

They tried to charge us $15 for a dessert fee AND they were out of the dessert we wanted.  COMPLETELY unacceptable.

Lastly, we asked they split the credit cards 70 % ours, and 30 % the other family we were with, and they messed up the split doing the wrong percentages on the wrong cards.

Needless to say, we won't be going here again!
author: Alex B.

description:
Garibaldi's is a small restaurant nestled amongst small businesses and residences.  There is no parking and tonight no valet.

We went for restaurant week which is a good way to try different restaurants often at a reduced price.  We had the lamb tenderloin which was very tasty as the entreé in our three course meal.

First course was a broccoli soup.

Dessert consisted of profiteroles and a decadent chocolate concoction.

The staff is pleasant and did a good job and gave it a feeling of a family run business, albeit we don't know if it is.

It was a little hard to find in the dark and he rain.  There is an area in front reserved for passenger drop off.
author: Allen S.

description:
I had not been back here in many years, so it felt like a new experience.

It is a neighborhood restaurant, just at the edge of my hood, and I really love the post dinner walk to my house on Lake St.

Ambiance is very good, the lighting is not too dark, and not too bright, just right. Service was very good, and our server from Hungary did not get offended when my friend asked her if she was Russian, but took in stride #classact.

We started with a couple of apps to taste, and they were fab. The Burrata was sprinkled in balsamic, and on very thin wafers.  Very good.  The Chicken Liver Pate was notable and rustic.

She had the Seared Local Bass, and I tasted. I'm trying that next time.

I was extremely pleased with the Steam Mussels.

All was washed down by a good sparkling wine - oh yes quite a decent wine list btw.

If you live around here, have dinner at Garibaldi's
author: Massimo M.

description: Loved my meal here! I got to try a variety of apps, all of which were great; potstickers prepared just right, great asparagus, and perfectly done crispy Brussels sprouts. I had the mussels for dinner and they were just right. Everything was capped off with house made ice sorbet and I was in heaven. Really great meal!
author: Zillah T.

description:
What a gem! Nestled in an unsuspecting location near the JCC. 

You can tell this is a neighborhood establishment, where folks have been coming for years, hiding in plain sight. The happy hour has a special menu and special seating area near-ish the bar. Pretty fun!

We had dinner. Despite the white table clothes it is very easy to be dressed down at G's.

We took a tapas approach to the menu, which has such good shareable food like the brussels sprouts and "papas bravas", it's hard not to. We ended up getting an entree as well, going with the chicken milanese. 

Don't Miss; THE BEST grilled cheese sandwich in San Francisco. And that means something in 2017.
author: Anthony H.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night. It was super busy and you could clearly hear it. It was actually way too loud as I had to ask my boyfriend to repeat everything he said and I couldn't hear the waiter at all. Service was also pretty slow, but it was also very busy, so it didn't bother me very much. The tables are placed very close to each other as well so it was difficult to shuffle in and out of the booth seating.

Aside from that, the food was great. I ordered the papas bravas which were deliciously seasoned and cooked to perfection. Crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside. I also got the calamari since the dinner plates looked like a lot of food. The calamari was also really good, but too salty even for someone who likes salt. Could also done without the crunchy tortilla bits on top. Ordered the lemon panna cotta to share, but it was super tiny and not really shareable.

Overall, I wish I could've liked this restaurant more, but the volume and layout were both very distracting to the experience. I'd give it another try on a weekday or something though.
author: Momo C.

description:
It is only based on 20 years of fond memories of Garibaldi's that I am not researching how to give a minus 10 rating to this restaurant.  After the absolutely horrible experience we had last night, July 6, 2018 between 6:30 and 8:00 PM we will NEVER eat here again.  For those interested I will provide details.

I should have know something was wrong when we arrived for our 6:30 reservation and there was no one at the reception desk and the place was almost empty.  I remember when the place would be packed on a Friday night, but it was the Friday after July 4th.  When someone did show up they had our name wrong in the reservation, but they did seat us at a table in the downstairs section as requested.  

The waiter was a nightmare from the beginning, surly would probably be the best description.  We asked for bread when he was asking about water choices and taking our drink order.  He was clearly annoyed when my spouse requested that he give his iPhone with the recipe for drink he wanted to the bartender.  When the drinks arrived, it was very clear the bartender had not followed the recipe so it had to sent back for correction and still came back missing the orange slice garnish requested.  When the drinks arrived and we repeated our request for bread the reply from the waiter was "I will bring it after I get your food order."  Are you kidding me, like we were going to order drinks, eat their bread, and not order food??  They grudgingly brought the bread before we ordered food.  When we asked to runner who brought it about the issue with bread and getting the food order he indicated that he was only able to bring it after clearing it with the manager.

Next my spouse asked for a Diet Coke which when it arrived it was flat.  When it was brought up to the waiter he snarled that he knew it and it was impacting all their bar carbonated drinks.  He did not offer any alternatives but we later discovered they had non-diet bottled drinks available.  At this point we requested to speak with the manager.

Really interesting to discover that the manager was this woman who had been doing upper arm stretches on a corner that was right by our table earlier.  Just assumed that person was a customer.  Long story short, her comment to us was "I am really busy with a lot of things, in case you hadn't noticed."  Maybe she was too busy approving bread orders?  She did offer the bottled drink alternative and my spouse ordered the root beer.

To be clear the food was OK.  Salads were great but one of our party ordered lamb which was clearly not fresh and was not served hot, more like lukewarm.  The member of our group who ordered the lamb got up from the table to have a side discussion with the manager about our overall disappointment with the dining experience.  Her overall reaction was that it was really too bad we felt that way but NO indication that she cared one way or the other, but maybe it was our problem. 

The next thing we know our bill appears on the table.  We were not asked if we wanted desert, coffee, after dinner drinks.  At that point we decided we would pay the bill, give zero tip, and leave.  As were walking out the door my spouse said to the manager it was really sad that the place we had loved for so many years was reduced to this state.  At that point the manager began screaming at him in front of a group of people in the entryway that we were unwelcome there and needed to leave.

I sincerely hope the owner of this restaurant reads this and seriously looks into the issues we encountered with the waiter and his manager.  The worst restaurant experience ever.
author: Richard M.

description:
Food here is amazing. The service is amazing. I take my mom here all the time because she's notoriously hard to please but she loves this place. (She always gets the short ribs. I always get the tagliatelle or the steak.)

This place is a little fancier, but since it's not on any "main strip" it's usually pretty quiet on weeknights and cozy (read: busy but comfortable) on a weekend as long as you have reservations. When they get their Groupon buzz on, it's out of this world. They also make great cocktails and can even recommend off menu cocktails if that's what you're looking for :) Save room for dessert!
author: Lai-Nin W.

description:
Two friends and I came for restaurant week and were pleased with our experience. The entry way is very crowded, especially when you have multiple groups waiting for a table. We were seated in the back section and our pink haired server was friendly and very helpful. 

Off of the restaurant week menu, I ordered:

Garibaldis Salad: lettuce, gorgonzola, pears, spiced walnuts, white balsamic vinaigrette - a good choice, but a little too wet for my taste. Gorgonzola, pears, and walnuts are always a good combo.

Lamb tenderloins: couscous, almonds, currants, broccoli, tarragon bearnaise - the lamb was tender and flavored in a way that made me think of Indian food. I wish there were more currants, and I loved the bearnaise!

Chocolate budino: espresso ice cream, salted caramel sauce, pralines - holy crap this was a decadent dream. My friend said "it's mushy cake but in the best kind of way", and I can't think of a better way to describe it. Dark chocolate goodness.
author: Christina S.

description: I am a terribly picky, spoiled eater I admit freely - having enjoyed some of the best food available in the world over my many years here on earth.  I have to say kudos to Garibaldi's for their amazing food, presentation, service - over the top!   Hubby and I and two very old, dear friends - all of us having been "in the business" for many years way back when, including owning our own in some cases - enjoyed the best meal in years there tonight.   I had the lamb - EXCEPTIONAL - tender, perfectly cooked (I had asked for it rare rather than the standard medium rare and it was perfect!).  One other had the mussels and told me they were to die for - another the pork chop and he ooooed and ahhhhed throughout - and my hubby had the Chicken Milanese and loved every moist, tender bite.   We began the meal by sharing an order of the zucchini fritters - incredibly delicious - and the CALAMARI - A MUST !!!   Unlike anything we had ever had before - charred perfectly - tender and juicy - topped off with one large Butino to share among us, it was a perfect end to a perfect meal.   The setting is very nice - small, intimate in the way of a European bistro - tight tables close together - white tablecloths - our service was perfect, too, from the friendly host to the bread dude, LOL - couldn't have asked for better.  Keep up the great work Girabaldi's - we'll be back!
author: Annie C.

description:
Came here for restaurant week on a Saturday night with my girlfriend as a belated birthday dinner. The service was excellent! We were immediately seated, as we had a reservation, and were promptly served water and a server came over to us. Our server was really friendly and overall nice! Throughout the entire dinner she came over to us and asked if things were ok/if we needed anything else.

The mushroom soup of the day was really good as the starter. From there, my girlfriend ordered the Ciopinno and I ordered the chicken breast. The Ciopinno was flavorful and delicious, same with the chicken breast.

We ordered the profiteroles and this pomegranate/lemon sorbet combo. We accidentally got served this flourless cake as well, but they let us keep it. All 3 desserts were delectable ! My overall favorite was the profiteroles.

Would recommend to everyone, the service and food is great!
author: James D.

description:
What a lovely local joint. The host let us know our wait would be over an hour but offered to have us sit at the bar as some of the ladies were about to be seated. 

Our bartender created an amazing hot toddy using their rosemary honey simple syrup, it woulda cured any sore throat. 

We got the brussels sprouts, mussels, ribs eye, and salmon dumplings. The brussel sprouts were awesome! The mussels were super delicious. The rib eye was cooked perfectly and sooooo soft and tender, it's sat on top of little bacon cubes red potato and spinach (all swimming in steak juice.... oh yeah, so goooood). The salmon dumplings I wasn't a fan of, the sauce it sat in was really good but the dumpling itself I didn't care for. 

Really friendly service and the food was really good! Would totally come by again and try something else!
author: Tamar B.

description: Garibaldi's delivered.  This is an ideal place for a date.  The food is fantastic and the ambience perfect for intimate conversation.  The brussels sprouts are both tender and crispy with a rich flavor.  The ribeye was magnificently cooked, if a bit fatty for my tastes.  Hiding beneath the ribeye was a small portion of potatoes au-gratin that hit the spot.  I recommend the salmon tartare to kick the meal off and panna cotta to finish it all off.
author: Charles W.

description:
Great food, service, dessert, wine. Everything was perfect. Loved the diner date we had here. 

Get the petite Chocolate boudin :)
author: Jasmeet K.

description:
I used to live in the neighborhood 3 years ago and this was my "go to" spot. Always delicious and service used to be great. This past year not so much. It's gone WAY DOWN HILL. I've ordered carry out several times this past year and they either forget items in the dish or the portions are 1/2 what they used to be. Burgers are never cooked right and the salad lettuce is wilted. 

I thought I'd give it one more try, and once again, sadly, tonight's service put the nail in the coffin for me. We sat down and no one came to greet us. After 15 mins we had to ask for someone to take drink orders. Then another 30 mins later, with no one approaching our table once again, we had to ask someone to take our order. Once our waiter did (who was horrible) he appeared to be in a hurry, no specials were mentioned (did they have any, don't know!), all he said was "what do you want?" My friend wanted a burger, the waiter wrote it down without asking how he wanted it prepared and never offered any extra topping options. Since I know their menu well, I stopped our waiter and said, my friend would like to know the topping options AND perhaps he'd like his burger cooked a certain way....no apologies, nothing. Just a quick "oh yeah" and then a cheeky response to me saying "do you want your chicken medium rare too?" RUDE!!! He is the bald waiter - just a sad representation of what used to be good service. THEN to top it off. Our orders come out another 30/40 mins after, but without the burger. We again had to call someone over to ask about the burger. No response. Again, where is the burger. 10/15 minutes later the burger arrives. Clearly, the kitchen did not fire it up - and did it last minute. 

THE SERVICE WAS BEYOND TERRIBLE. I don't know what's going on with Garibaldis but it's way too overpriced now for below average service and unpredictable food quality. 

I would highly recommend you go somewhere else to enjoy your evening!
author: Michele F.

description:
This is a very classy restaurant with great service and attention to detail.  I heard about this place from my friend and I know it has been here for awhile and is also a neighborhood favorite.  I was excited to try it finally!

I enjoyed everything from the bread with sauce to the Caesar salad to the foie gras to my seared tuna entree to our budino dessert and our rose wine.  Yum!  We had a nice corner table where my friend and I could catch up over our scrumptious meal, and I loved our whole dining experience as our server took such great care of us but gave us plenty of space and time to carry on our conversation.  

I cannot wait to come back!
author: Maile N.

description:
It's been ages since I had a meal this delicious! My husband I just dropped in with plans to have a pre-dinner cocktail and try and appetizer. It turned into a great date and not only did we stay for dinner but desert too. I'm so glad we did. 
I ordered a dirty vodka martini and asked Jenny, the bartender, to make my husband "a manly cocktail." Man O War it is! Mine was delicious and my husband enjoyed his unique concoction as well. ( Whiskey with a Rosemary-Honey syrup and ???)
We started with the mussels. AMAZING. I am not a huge seafood eater but I LOVED these. Made with garlic, jalapeno and white wine, perfect. We also tried the olive tapenade served with sliced bread and focaccia-again, wonderful. 
We were enjoying ourselves so much my husband wanted to stay and have dinner. Pretty sure we consumed a dinner's worth of calories already but...why not? We are on vacation. 
We split the signature Chicken Milanese. It arrived and looked perfect. Each aspect of  this dish was on point. The chicken was juicy yet crispy, potatoes were lightly seasoned not overpowering the taste of the vegetable and the arugula salad was a star as well. 
I think around this time was when he got cocktail # 2 and so I did to but switched it up and got the cucumber martini. I wish I had seen that sooner because i would have started with that. Tasted very light and fresh. Sooo good. 
Since we were on vacation.....DESERT! Jenny surprised us with the Chocolate Budino. To.Die.For. Espresso ice cream, chocolate cake and candied pralines. I know..heaven. 
We ate at the bar since we just planned on drinks but the service was fantastic. 

All the staff were great! Can't wait to go back and try the Asparagus Risotto...Asparagus Risotto...It's calling my name. See you soon Garibaldi's. XOXO
author: Amy O.

description:
You know what's easy to find? Great food (just pay up for it)

You know what's much harder to find? A restaurant that has great food, but that is consistent (night in night out), reasonable (pricing wise), charming (neighboorhood and ambiance).

Garibaldi's has all of that at lunch and dinner -- and they top that off with the best and most amazingly priced happy hour in the entire city to boot.
author: Sai S.

description: Loved the roasted chicken with bacon braised collard greens and onion cheddar biscuit.  Great cocktails, too.  Try the Vesper!
author: Donna D.

description:
What a wonderful place for really good comfort food. Consistent, high quality, creative and very competent. Having come here over many years I've always had a great experience.

This time I had a three bean salad to start.  Beautiful quality beans of varied sizes and deliciously dressed. The portion was large and I couldn't stop munching at it.  With a glass of white wine it was divine.

Then I had the halibut, perfectly prepared. It was tender, moist and cooked just right.  The salsa with it, all around the sides, was delicious and a highlight of the meal including the cubes of bacon. The entire dish was tasty and provided lots of satisfaction.

On a weekday evening at 9pm the place was packed. The Belle Monde comes out in force. The decor is sophisticated and intimate. I will say that it does get noisy. 
This is a charming neighborhood gem and always worth a visit.
author: Tom B.

description: I have been going to this restaurant possibly since the early eighties. I was friends with the previous owner and often took guests there. I noticed a drop in quality of staff a few years ago but kept going because of the old school feel and despite the fact that the wait staff was getting more and more difficult and the bar service was sub part ie they never mixed special drinks the way you requested. But this last time was basically the last straw as the waitrr was rude and dismissive and the food was not prepared in a fresh and piping hot manner...without going into great detail, our guests were very disappointed in the service; diet cokes were served flat even tho the waiter was well aware of this. Upon requesting to speak with the manager she was extremely short and rude; something I have NEVER experienced there before. I expressed sadness to her about how much the restaurant has been slipping and I was rudely ordered out of the place as I was leaving. So sad to see an old establishment truly losing it's grip on the basics of decent food and drink preparation as well as friendliness and professionalism. Good-bye Garibaldis....It WAS a special dining experience long ago and far away but unfortunately it is no longer. Any body interested in taking over???
author: Petet G.

description:
I can't pass up on giving this restaurant a 5-star rating. There's so much fine dining in SF  that I haven't visited but this place just rocked our evening! I'm glad we made reservations because when we arrived the place was packed! We arrived half an hour early but we're able to get seated in 3 mins. We were seated towards the back where there was a little bit more privacy & where we could have a much audible conversation. It was my stepson's 23rd birthday that we've been celebrating all week & we could not have picked a better place. 

We ordered a few small plates to share namely: warm kale salad (refreshing), bacon wrapped asparagus (oh so good!) and the risotto croquettes that they're known for. All good and as a foodie I could taste the blending of flavors on each bite. Yumm! 

Once your palate has been introduced to good food, you'd want more right? I ordered the chicken Milanese only coz I saw on the menu beurre blanc and my oh my! It was heaven! it was a great pair with the chicken. I've had beurre blanc with fish before but not with chicken. The salad was a bit bland but not disappointing. My husband ordered their version of a chicken pot pie and I must admit I like it a lot! I like all the ingredients exposed and not filleted and the crust was added for texture & presentation. 

The boys ordered the halibut and although it appeared to be a smaller serving  than our plates, Alex said that it was delicious. He's from San Diego and had a lot of fish before but if he said it was good then that's legit. Mason ordered the lamb tenderloin. He didn't say much but was quietly munching his food & finished first. It looked like a win for him considering we were nudging him to try the ribeye instead. 

For dessert, we ordered the large serving of profiteroles and arrived on our table with a birthday candle and a happy birthday around it. The profiteroles and the sauce we're delicious and were tempted to order another serving. 

We were expecting small portions for a fine dining restaurant but their servings were more than I thought. Our bill came to $200 (3 apps, 4 entrees, desserts) without alcohol and that is a reasonable price for fine dining in SF for 4 guests. Our waitress was very attentive and served promptly. 

Valet parking is $10 and very convenient.
author: Ammie A.

description:
Great calm atmosphere (good for a romantic date, or just a night out with the family) 
Amazing pate
Great halibut
author: Mary N.

description:
Garibaldi's is a hip little place in Oakland that has been around for quite some time. I got there on a Friday night and there was a pretty long wait. The restaurant isn't that big, but it can get pretty crowded depending on what time you arrive. The atmosphere is very calm and soothing, with dim lights and candles surrounding the place. 

I remember ordering two appetizers, an asparagus dish and a fried calamari plate. The Calamari didn't have that overly fried and crunchy feel, but it was rather light and tasty. The asparagus had a unique oyster sauce that was very interesting and worked very well. For my main course, I had an Alaskan Halibut and it was steamed to perfection. I have to say that the food was presented well and tasted good. The price is what you'd expect to pay for an upscale restaurant. If you happen to find yourself in this area and want to treat yourself to a fancy meal, I would definitely recommend Garibaldi's.
author: Steve N.

description:
We had a lovely meal here last night! We called ahead and made a reservation for 745 on a Saturday. The restaurant is modern, yet cozy and very clean and the seating is well organized for such a small place. 

We started with cocktails and the roasted potatoes. They were coked perfectly!!! The Irish girl in me was very impressed. For the main courses I got the steak and my girlfriend got the Korean BBQ ribs and her bf got the gnocchi and a salad. My steak was soooooo god and a huge serving. 

We finished out the meal with two desserts, the mi t cookie sandwich and the brownie sundae. They had fancy names, but that's what they were. The chocolate was really good and the mint ice cream was creamy and delicious.

The only reason I'm knocking a star off is because the chilled noodles that came with the BBQ ribs was so salty it was unenjoyable. Also the puff pastry that came with the ice cream was "meh"

For the three of us with the above items along with two cocktails each it was $210. I thought this was very reasonable for great food and a lovely ambiance.
author: Sashy M.

description:
Came here for NYE pre-fixe dinner.

Lobster bisque was awful.   I couldn't even bring myself to finish it.   It had a strange aftertaste and was really bitter.

Dungeness crab linguine was not very good either.   Crab was smelled way too fishy that it made the dish difficult to eat.  Also,  the "linguine" is definitely not linguine I'm used to.   Too many herbs in pasta, but no flavor. 

Chocolate bodino - only redeeming part was the Gelato.   The chocolate espresso cake was again way too bitter.  I couldn't finish it. 

The service was abysmal.   I think we were or waiter's first table in life.  

Maybe they're better on a regular day, but do not do the pre-fixe menus!
author: BizzyLizzy K.

description:
I'm so happy that this place was open on Memorial Day. Everything else was closed.. which seemed odd because if everyone's off work, wouldn't they need to eat still!?

Anyway, the inside is nice. We started off drinks.. I ordered a shirley temple with ginger ale. I think the waitress kind of judged me for a second there because she gave me a funny look when I gave my order.

I also ordered the orchiette pasta with cheese and added a side of grilled chicken. The selling point for this dish for me was the truffle oil and when I couldn't taste it at ALL. I debated for like 15 minutes on whether or not to say something, but with every bite I got sadder and sadder until finally my companion said something to the waitress as he couldn't bear it any longer.

So I got a side of truffle oil and it was BOMB and it made me so much happier. 

We also had the brussel sprouts which are supposed to be very popular. Good taste but a little too oily for my liking. 

The service here is exceptional. The food is alright. I think I would like to come back for dinner sometime.
author: Angela L.

description:
I made a reservation for a specific table by phone. The maitre d confirmed that it was the owner with whom I spoke when I came in for dinner, but denied I had reserved a specific table.  Ugh.  I tried to reach the owner by telephone to discuss the issue and got a delayed return call -- until after a negative review was posted. Double Ugh.  When she eventually called back, she admitted the restaurant failed to honor the reservation for the specific table and denied I had reserved the table with her.  Triple and quadruple ugh.  

Before this unfortunate experience, I'd eaten there twice -- good food, nice atmosphere, but please honor your obligations and be straight with your diners.
author: Shanin S.

description: What a wonderful place for really good comfort food. Consistent, high quality, creative and very competent. I really enjoyed this place! My favorite part about it would have to be that cool burger they had which was so delicious even with the dijon mustard!
author: Karlie F.

description:
An excellent neighborhood restaurant; lunch, dinner, drinks, business, or brunch, Garibaldis is great! 

I've never had a bad meal, the bar comfortable, the service impeccable, reservations on weekends, and walk in weekdays, what more do you need? Try the chicken, have the fish, the croquette? Delish! 

If you live in SF it's a classic, not to be missed.
author: Ryan P.

description: Lovely little restaurant in Laurel Heights. Everyone at the table enjoyed their meal and the desserts were pretty good. It ended up being pretty pricey. The drinks were almost as expensive as the entree and not different than any other bar.
author: Alison S.

description:
Great ambience with wait staff who takes accountability. Cozy,minimalist, and elegant space. 

We had the Monterey squid ( super tender squid but didn't love the fried potato strips. Warm kale saad was amazing - softer kale leaves without too much marination that comes with lemon or salad dressing. Great quality kale without the over-fibrous texture of curly kales. 

We all love the warm olive dip with garlic, roasted peppers, shallot, onion. Feeling inspired to make it myself. 

The pork in the pappardelle was so tender that it just melts in one's mouth. But the dish would benefit from a bit more salt (we ask for some more on the side) and a more al dente texture of the pappardelle. 

The Sangiovese from Russian river that goes with the pasta was excellent.

They were a bit in serving us due to a confusion between the waiters. They came over to apologize profusely and then comp us the wine. I like restaurants that could recognize the problem and take actions against it.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
Horrible choice for our Valentine's Day dinner. Spent $240 on a dinner for two to have a sticky fork, two dirty wine glasses, stone cold prime rib that instead of restarting they just threw back in the oven leading to an overcooked steak, a dirty dessert plate, and to add insult to injury a dirty glass on their "our apologies" port wine.

Service was terribly slow, not to mention one of the servers who just stood by the bathroom door on his phone with frequent trips into the bathroom for god knows what. The same server got two table's orders next to us swapped...

First and last time here.
author: Luis F.

description:
Last minute selection, we were so pleased with our choice. Party of three, and we all enjoyed our dinners, top to bottom. Still savoring the roasted Brussels sprouts, three weeks later. 

A little hard to find in the dark (and the rain), but we had no trouble parking across the street. 

Go. You'll love it.
author: Ellie P.

description: We had an excellent time at Girabaldi's.  The food and wine was all superb. Risotto balls were delicious as well as the pate. Some of the best pate I've ever had. My dish was delicious. Everything was great all around. I highly recommend this place!  Service was also top notch, our server was great!  Can't wait to go again
author: Melissa L.

description: Came here for the SF restaurant week special menu and got the Garibaldi salad while my boyfriend got the chicken Milanese sandwich with fries (which I sampled) both were really good. I loved the salad- came with grilled chicken, candied nuts, apples, and cheese. Then for dessert he got the sorbet and I got the thing with spearmint ice cream which I liked. Place was nice but not too pretentious, bathroom very clean and smelled good which I always appreciate.
author: Anna L.

description: 5pm to 6pm very Happy Hour! Duck paté with crostini and burger are best amuse bouche ! Excellent service, place is cozy and chic, the bar is quickly full, so better arrive early. The diner is also a tasty experience. Because the room is not too big, it feels very cozy, elegant lighting.
author: Claire M.

description:
I had a travelzoo voucher and I feel like it really changed the service we received...so the drop from 4 stars to 3 is for the waiter we had, mostly because we could hear him telling the table behind us about all of the entrees and for us - he asked if we'd been there before and then just let us order off the menu. 

The food is outstanding - we started with the ceviche and tater tots (whipped potatoes with bacon and cheese breaded and fried). I loved the ceviche flavors and the sweet potato chips. Nice touch. 

I had the halibut and my husband had the rabbit ragu on pappardelle - both were delicious. The halibut came with an assortment of veggies and herbs - very nice and a crispy sear on the fish.  The ragu had english peas and some sort of chard mixed in - also very nice.  Wine list needs some love IMHO, but the lemonade was outrageous!

I've been for lunch before and really enjoyed it. Hope this can provide a training opportunity for management because I've always enjoyed this before.
author: Christine V.

description: For my best friend's birthday, I wanted to surprise her with a birthday dinner as my treat. Given I live in Los Angeles and couldn't be there in person to treat her to the surprise, Cate Mason, manager of Garibaldi's, helped me set up every step of the surprise from handing her a birthday card I mailed to the restaurant to helping me set up payment via email, she made sure the birthday girl was well taken care of. The dinner ended up being a perfect surprise, leaving the birthday girl in tears and I could not have pulled this off without Cate and her staff. The couple who enjoyed the meal said the food and service were IMPECCABLE and would recommend to family and friends, as would I. Next time I am in the Bay Area I will definitely be making a stop here and would also recommend it to anyone who is looking for a fantastic meal in the city. Cate - thank you again for making such a special moment for me and my friend!
author: Brenda C.

description: I had never dined at Garibaldi's before but boy oh boy I will return. I brought my sister, niece, and nephew in for a going away dinner for my nephew. Josiah was our waiter. Every single dish that we ordered was a delight: from the brussel sprouts, the Garibaldi salad - and the divine wild mushroom risotto. Yum! We all ordered different entrees. (I had the risotto) and everyone shared tastes of the plates. My sister was the only one who has room for dessert - and she ordered a Meyer Lemon cheese sweet that was out of this world.  The service was impeccable. At one point, I looked around the crowded space and noticed everyone seemed local. That explained it all. The locals figured out that Garibaldi's was a standout. I am going back.
author: Molly M.

description: Neighborhood Italian with outstanding food and service. We took a large party and they looked after us very well. Good value. Tends to be noisy.
author: john S. g.

description:
A neighborhood restaurant, I rated it a 5 for the entire "package" of menu selection and good tasting food, ambiance, quiet location and  friendliness of the servers.

The staff was warm, friendly and welcoming the moment we walked in.  The restaurant was crowded but it turned out to be easy to talk and carry on a conversation which was a breath of fresh ar.

The craft cocktails were tasty and not watered down; the server (Pilar, she was great) offered a small taste test of several wines by the glass before we settled on the Faust. The food was fantastic.  We ordered appetizers of papas bravas, shaved asparagus and chicken liver pate, main dish of Korean style short ribs and desserts of profiteroles and broken banana cream pie.

I felt the value of the meal and experience was excellent.  Our waitress Pilar AND sitting in the main dining area  contributed significantly to the dining experience.  There are 10 or more tables in the back of the restaurant with no windows and little view of the main dining room that I would not recommend
author: john f.

description:
What I like about Garibaldi's is that it is an old school place they is very consistant in the quality.
The food is simple and tasty, cocktails are good and the atmosphere is nice - though it can be quite loud. It is also very easy to get a table - and a parking spot - as it is not one of those trendy places.
We go there at least once a month and have never been disappointed so far.
author: Sebastien G.

description: Fantastic place. Great atmosphere, service. Super professional yet lay back. Highly recommend....
author: Sabina A.

description:
I don't recall what we ordered entirely, but service was good, and they were quick to refill water and wine glasses. 

The appetizers were tasty, like the chicken live pate, and some deep fried...somethings. Rissoto balls perhaps?

My caesar salad was great (I was too full for a main course) but I tried my friend's chicken dishes which were excellent. They wished my friend a happy birthday and brought out a cake.

Overall really decent, nice decor, will need to go back for a proper review one day.
author: Jordan C.

description: Love everything here. Ambiance, service and of course the food. I don't think you can go wrong with anything. I actually have never been here for dinner only lunch. The chicken Milanese is very good. Garabaldi salad is sometimes great, sometimes just ok. When you get the grilled chicken added, realize it will be charred with a definitely char taste.
author: Piper W.

description: Why is this place rated four stars?? It's awful! Our waiter was rude and basically ignored us the entire time we were there, and our food was really not good. My grilled cheese sandwich was 'okay', but the salad it came with was disgustingly bitter and my husband's food was just awful. We were disappointed, as this place came pretty highly recommended, but we would definitely not go back. The place is tiny and crowded with the next table basically right on top of you and it just wasn't worth it.
author: Leora W.

description:
Happy Birthday Lap Dance Linda! 

*Bottle service at one of SF's newest lounge: Check! 

*Too pretty to eat cupcakes: Check! 

*Delectable birthday dinner: Ehhhh... :X

With all glowing 5 star reviews and comparisons to Spruce (which I love), Garibaldi's seemed promising when I was planning my friend's birthday dinner. However, after leaving Garibaldi's on Saturday, it left me thinking that some people seriously need to lay off their bongs. 

While the menu was enticing, the food was not well executed. Almost every single dish our party ordered had major flaws; from overcooked food, odd ingredient pairings to funky one dimensional flavor profiles, it's not what you would expect from a seasoned chef. To put it nicely, I've had more appetizing food at Elephant Bar and I'm not a fan of chain restaurants. 

As other Yelpers stated, portions are huge (which doesn't matter if the food is no good) but wine and food are overpriced. Unless you're a $$$$ or a Michelin starred restaurant, your average wine by the glass shouldn't be $14 nor should any entrees be nearly $40 (unless it's lobster or kobe) which was the case at Garibaldi's. 

F O O D
*CHICKEN LIVER PATE w/ Dijon Mustard, Maple-Sherry Gelée & Croutons ($8) - 2.5 STARS 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/p6bLw7PS63Kbge_wyIOP8w?select=Qix_Ya7wzWJGMAYVC83ddg#sle-QKylgfXGOmsHqNtXGA
Although massive in portion, it was unappetizingly sweet from the maple-sherry gelee. Sweet liver? Not a good thing.

*STEAK TARTARE w/ Lemon, Capers, Parmesan, Radishes, Whipped Mustard & Pickled Red Onions ($16) - 2 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/p6bLw7PS63Kbge_wyIOP8w?select=Qix_Ya7wzWJGMAYVC83ddg#Qix_Ya7wzWJGMAYVC83ddg
I've never had a bad tartare until Garibaldi's. The ridiculously bland tartare (no egg yolk nor did I detect lemon or capers) was doused with flavorless "whipped mustard" and served alongside ginormous parsley leaves, Parmesan shavings, long strands of pickled onions and radishes that distracted from the tartare (all should have been finely minced). No crostinis or bread was served with the tartare. *scratches head* 

*BRAISED SHORT RIBS w/ Soft Polenta, Roasted Broccoli & Spicy Red Pepper Agrodolce ($29.50) - 2 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/p6bLw7PS63Kbge_wyIOP8w?select=_UmyuyGCnAUxPz8VABPa0Q#3SjDN3Ai4f87bniANFv_mA
A dish made for denture wearers, everything tasted like mush and severely needed a crunchy texture contrast. Although the shortribs were fall-off-the-bone tender, the agrodolce that lacquered the ribs was grossly sweet (not spicy as stated on the menu) and reminded me of Gerber food. I ate part of one rib and threw the rest on Mr. NSS' plate.  

*MARINATED LAMB TENDERLOINS w/ Couscous, Pistachios, Golden Raisins, Summer Beans & Tarragon Sauce ($36) - 3 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/p6bLw7PS63Kbge_wyIOP8w?select=_UmyuyGCnAUxPz8VABPa0Q#xzwLKLtVdR6c_pEIBiJvMQ
Mr. NSS dish fared better as the lamb was rich in Moroccan spices but was a bit dry. The couscous was overcooked and lacked a toothsome bite. 

Other guests ordered the Risotto Croquettes which they said tasted like tater tots, Seared Tuna that was overcooked and bland, Pork Tenderloin that tasted like Panda Express Orange Chicken, and Pork Belly that was ALL fat. 

To the Chef(s): Please lay off all the parsley. I swear someone got too parsley happy in the kitchen and made my dishes rain with oddly ginormous parsley leaves. I'm still having parsley nightmares.

S E R V I C E
This could have easily been a 2 Star review but service was Garibaldi's saving grace. The friendly hostess sat half of the guests at the table as we waited for the birthday girl. Our waitress was genuinely sweet, friendly, and attentive as were the bus boys. They did get one of the orders wrong but quickly remedied it. Timing of the food service was on point and surprisingly quick for a large party. Dinner was less than two hours for a party of 10. There's 20% auto gratuity for parties 6 or more. Prix-Fixe menu required for parties 12 or more. 

A M B I A N C E / D E C O R
Contemporary and sophisticated, Garibaldi's is nicer than your typical neighborhood restaurant with contrasting dark and light décor, olive furnishings, and stunning floral arrangements. With seating for 90 people, it's good date place and also well-suited for larger parties. 

P A R K I N G
Fairly easy street parking. Valet parking is available for $10.

The best part of dinner for the birthday girl (no, she's not a stripper) was her Complimentary Chocolate Budino dessert which thankfully, they didn't make it rain with parsley leaves.
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Garibaldi's garners a 3 star rating in my book. 
It is what Yelp considers 3 stars: a-ok.
Nothing special, nothing to write home about. 
The service was great and attentive. They were quick to fix mistakes and replaced my entree with the proper one in a mere matter of 5 minutes. I imagined someone in the kitchen yelling out "LAMB RAGU, ON THE FLY!" 
I will, however, note that it is overpriced.

While I opted for the more wallet friendly 2 course prie-fix menu priced at $21 (to celebrate their 21st anniversary), my friends went and ordered a la carte. I did also order the steak tartare (which fell short, flavorwise)

The steak tartare.. Where do I begin. At $16, it's a pretty hefty size. steak tartare, lemon, capers, parmesan, radishes, whipped mustard, pickled red onions. The radishes and whipped mustard did not work for me. First, I thought the whipped mustard was whipped butter. It didn't taste like mustard at all. I suppose the radishes were used for the bitterness to help with the mustard? Didn't work for me. It's missing a raw egg yolk. There was also a ton of flat leaf parsley. I didn't bother to mix most of it with my tartare. It felt too salady. 

The 2 course for $21 consists of:

braised lamb ragu: garganelli pasta, portobella mushrooms,
bellwether farms ricotta, mint

and a chocolate espresso bread pudding. 

The birthday girl (sitting next to me) had ordered the marinated lamb tenderloins. It had 3 pieces of tenderloin sitting on a mountain of couscous with beans sticking out. I know first hand because this was also what I was given when I had ordered "the pre fixe" My dish of lamb tenderloins was returned and I was told that my lamb ragu would be ready in about 5 minutes. 

The braised lamb ragu itself is just good, but missing something. I felt it was a bit rather on the spicy side. It definitely had some kick, followed with some heat. I certainly didn't taste any mint but I found myself wishing it had some peas or something! Also, the portobella mushrooms were cooked with too much olive oil. Whenever I would get a chunk of mushroom, all I could taste was olive oil. If I can taste this through the sauce, that's kind of bad. 

Tried a piece of the lamb tenderloin. Tasted like stewed beef to me honestly. I wasn't impressed. If I had ordered that I would've been upset. $36 for 3 pieces of lamb tenderloin that tastes like stewed beef sitting on top of a bed of couscous!? Come on.. Let's be real here. That's overpriced. Ok. I digress.

Bday girl's brother orderd a 3 item anti pasti. He picked the watermelon, risotto croquettes, and chicken liver pate. I loved the chorizo spices on the watermelon. Made me think of the fruit stand in the Mission buying mangoes with Taijin sprinkled all over them. He felt the watermelon wasn't compressed enough but I was fine iwth it. 
The risotto croquettes tasted like tater tots. It had fontina cheese and a tomato coulis but the fontina was lost amongst all the breading, hence the tater tot comment. 
I liked the pate well enough, but another friend did not. She felt it was too sweet.  It was probably the maple-sherry gelee. I was able to hide it with the dijon mustard.

I definitely would not make this place a destination. If you're around, I guess it's fine. I really think there are more restaurants in San Francisco that are able to execute flavors better with the same price tag.
author: Susy C.

description:
A little meh here and a little meh there.
We came here after a show at the JCC for the SFDFF, acronyms-oh my! We were drawn in by the cute curb appeal and very good smell wafting to the sidewalk.  We came a little late, about an hour before closure, and were seated within 5 minutes.
When we ordered our drinks and our waters we found out that the first two wines we inquired about were "86'd" for the night which was fine since we got there so late. 
Our wines came about 10 minutes later but no water, a few minutes go by and our still waters are brought but my sparkling was still a miss.15 minutes go by and just as I'm about to post a tip on yelp regarding service-BOOM, sparkling!
The first two dishes we chose were also out for the night, which was to be expected after the wine, so we ordered the burata, beets, and mussels to share.  After taking our order our waitress disappeared until dessert time, which is usually fine but we were all out of water and sparkling and wine...
Decor:
Dark, upscale, and intimate.  Most of the patrons around us hit their heads on the lamps above the tables while exiting... may be something to consider if they're due for a remodel. 
Food:
The beets were pretty tasty, the feta paired marvelously.  The burata was a bit of a disappointment.  It didn't taste like anything special, I've had burata numerous times and this tasted bland.  There was no flavor besides basic mozzarella and a hint of basil-even though there was a leaf on every bite-perhaps the basil was not fresh?  The presentation was quaint though.
The mussels... oh gee.  The bread that came with it was divine, the smell was a bit off putting but the taste of the smoked bread was delicious, the mussels came with some sausage in the middle I believe but as I didn't read it/choose it and I'm a vegetarian I was a bit surprised.  There were also a few mussels that were sealed shut, which are a danger to eat and although we knew better, a tourist or individual eating mussels for the first time, the would have no clue and get extremely sick.
Service:
The service was meager, ...shall we? She didn't bring us the bowl for the mussels until we were halfway through, we were not offered bread like other patrons, our waters were never refilled, we didn't get our waters until after our wine then after we ordered, she said she would come back to check on us after she took our order and she never did until it was time for the dessert menu.  She was misinformed on the wine, she tried to have us order a cabernet after she stated that it was a pinot, we caught her and she apologized but ... if you work here-shouldnt you know what you're talking about?  Also, the food that they were out of should've been announced by her when she handed us the menu.

Overall, probably not coming back.  The wine was the best part and I can go to any wine bar for that.  Sorry charlie, we were extremely unimpressed- so much that we only tipped 10% and she didn't even deserve it.
author: Sara N.

description: Delicious.  Great servers, amazing food.  They were very accommodating since one of my girlfriends has a food allergy. I had the ribs and although the portions were small(only for this dish), they were the most tender I've had in a long time.  I will definitely be returning.
author: Cathy M.

description: It was my Mom's Birthday Dinner.  Liz, our waitress, was a delightful host to our celebration.  My Mom & girlfriend had the Chicken Milanese.  I would argue, it's the best in town.  For appetizers, they had this amazing olive tapenade with an assortment of breads & we enjoyed their Heirloom Tomatoes.  I had the the Fresh Tagliatelle Pasta, a journey of savory flavor in every bite.  The pasta is made so thin that the meatballs shine through & the Calabrian Chili gives those plum tomatoes just right amount of kick.  A dollop of ricotta & fresh basil make this my favorite pasta dish in San Francisco.  The birthday girl even stole my dish for a bit.  But what could I do?  I only owe her my life.  And save room for dessert!  The Chocolate Budino should be called the Chocolate Bombdino, a bomb of decadence.  Thanks Liz, you made Mom's Birthday Celebration so memorable.
author: Gary B.

description:
This place is an overpriced waste of space... with marginal service.

The meal started with a cocktail... a Tom Waites. The cocktail was fantastic. It set me into the right mood for some awesome food... which never arrived.

The chicken liver pate tasted... well... simple. There was nothing wrong with it, just like there's nothing wrong with eating bologna, but there was very little interesting or complex.

The Ceasar salad tasted like trader joe's bagged lettuce, overdressed. Oh, and the charge extra for anchovies, but they don't tell you they charge extra for anchovies. And they do finely shredded cheese where one wants course cheese shavings to stand up to the dressing.

The main course pasta, this is a nominal Italian restaurant, was worthless. The sauce tasted like canned sauce with a few extra spices thrown in. Once again, nothing complex, just some sauce over pasta.

The desserts were shockingly bad. The bananas were just jello vanilla pudding with bananas and cinnamon and the hot chocolate seemed to be swiss miss.

San Francisco is full of awesome restaurants. A-16 is radically better than Garibaldi's, a mile away, and similarly priced. If you want to wander to the south side, there's Joe's of Westlake and the "authentic east coast mafia-style Italian" at Val's.

The only reason I could see for going to Garibaldi's is one does not want to drive anywhere, lives nearby, and the difference between a $20/person and $100/person meal is meaningless.

Oh... and they add a 4.75% surcharge for "San Francisco employment related costs." This was the rotting cherry on top of the nondescript sundae of a meal.
author: David P.

description: nice neighborhood spot for a date. good cocktails and helpful servers.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
Still got it.

This place has been around forever.  And I am pleased to report that the food and atmosphere is just as good as I remember.  

I had the braised short ribs pasta and my husband had the lamb tenderloin.   You know it's good when you're still talking about it the next day.  This will definitely remain on my hit list when I'm in San Francisco. 

If you're looking for a mean cocktail, try the Man O War. It will start your night off right.
author: Robyn B.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised by the food here, and the prices won't break the bank!

APPETIZERS: Wow, the grilled calamari was just wow - flavorful, tender, delicious. The burratta bruchetta was also good, but I find that the delicate texture of the cheese was overwhelmed by the bread.

ENTREES: I thought for sure the pork tenderloin would be the winner today (too sweet, nothing amazing), but the lamb tenderloin was so flavorful and tender, pretty much like a glorified lamb kabob. Based on stalking other tables, I would probably try the roasted chicken, and skip on the salmon (looked pretty ordinary).

DESSERTS: I am so glad they offered 2 desserts in a "petite" portion at a discounted price ($6) vs. the regular sized dessert. The server says the regular portion is really not that much bigger, so it's a better deal to diversify! I knew for sure that the Chocolate Budino would be awesome, and it was good, but tasted like a pretty basic flourless chocolate cake in a cup. The real dessert winner was the strawberry shortake, I predicted wrong again! The cream was perfect, and there were chunks of shortcake inside. D.R.O.O.L.
author: Jess C.

description:
I had an excellent Dine About Town experience at Garibaldi's. It's a classic restaurant with simple but well-made dishes.

Both our hostess and waitress were very sweet. Our waitress was enthusiastic and upbeat, describing her favorites and recommendations and leaving us plenty of room/time to decide on what we wanted. Luckily all the items I was curious to try were on the Dine About Town menu!

To start I had the burrata. It was really fresh, not as polished and primped as burrata at other restaurants I've had in the past, but instead more of a slurpy, satisfying spread. It complemented the bed of arugula and tomato puree nicely. I got three pieces of bread with it, which was sufficiently generous given I had their starter bread as well. I actually think a crispier, more flatbread-like bread could pair better.

For the entree I had the orechiette pasta. It was fantastically prepared. The cute helmet-shaped pasta were cooked to the right texture and the braised beef was marinated in a slightly tangy and BBQ-like sauce. Interesting pairing of flavors. The only flavor I wasn't a fan of was the orange glaze. It's a very subtle flavor but I felt like it didn't belong in a savory dish like that. 

Dessert was satisfying - I had the lemon panna cotta. The lemon was almost undetectable (which is good for me because I am lukewarm about citrus-flavored sweets) and I liked the interesting pairing of pistachios. My sister had the cream puffs. I thought the bread was a little too thick compared to the filling.

Parking is not bad in the area after 6 pm. We found a metered spot on an adjacent street. 

When I first walked in I noticed the clientele was on the older side, but it changed to a younger crowd by the time we finished our meal and walked out the door. I guess my sister and I have the dining habits of your grandmother.

Give Garibaldi's a try especially if you're in the Presidio. Dine About Town is a fantastic opportunity to try this quality restaurant.
author: Brandy A.

description:
We took one of our favorite clients here for dinner. Beautiful ambiance, excellent service, but my Caesar Salad was "meh" at best. Although I did taste the other dishes that came to the table and they were delicious...except the calamari...which just is a matter of preference. 

All in all, a great place and would definitely come back again.
author: Darija W.

description: I have a 75% genetic hearing loss. I have dealt with this very challenging handicap for almost all of my life, and sadly my condition has gotten much worse over the past year (despite the valiant attempts of the very greatest experts in the field at UCSF Medical Center, all well documented.) I ate at this restaurant tonight. Unfortunately, due to my handicap, my voice sometimes gets louder in noisy environments. This restaurant is very noisy. Tables are packed in, and there is only a gap of inches between them.  The restaurant was filled with other Pacific and Presidio Heights diners, all talking happily and enthusiastically . . . and not quietly. Which would normally not be an issue. And is not normally ever an issue at any other restaurant. However, halfway through the meal tonight, the manager, Andrew, came to our table and officiously told me I was speaking too loudly, and needed to keep my voice down. It was completely humiliating for me, in front of my dining companion. After he came to the table, I approached this manager (Andrew) privately, told him I would try to keep my voice down, but explained to him my handicap and my situation, and that to a large extent it was beyond my control.  He was 100% unsympathetic. He tersely told me I could leave the restaurant if I was not able to keep my voice down. "You don't have to eat here," was his actual quote. He was rude and cruel when I explained my disability. He made absolutely no attempt whatsoever to understand, or have any compassion whatsoever, for my handicap. He had absolutely no comprehension that he had embarrassed me. At this point, we finished our meal quickly, did not order dessert, and left. I will never eat in this restaurant, ever again. And tomorrow, I will file a complaint with the ADA, as this is legally my right under the Americans With Disabilities Act. Nobody deserves to be humiliated over their genuine handicap. And tonight was a completely and totally disheartening and humiliating experience for me, in a situation where I do not have the ability to gauge the volume of my voice in a noisy environment. And this is a VERY noisy restaurant, hardly the public library. I would add that when we arrived at this restaurant, we specifically asked this very same manager, Andrew, for a quiet table in the back . . . where there were some empty tables.  But instead he seated us right in the middle of the main dining room, right next to the bar, in the noisiest possible area, with other tables (and diners) on either side of us just inches away.  Even after my explanation to him, he made no attempt to move us to a quieter area of the restaurant.  And so, do not go to this restaurant unless all of your facilities are in perfect working order, otherwise you will be embarrassed and humiliated. A hearing handicap is no different from any other legitimate handicap, and the way I was treated tonight was inexcusable, and completely discriminatory. But apparently, any handicap which might minimally inconvenience other diners is not tolerated at Garibaldi's. Garibaldi's policy is that unless you are perfect, stay home and order take out.
author: George D.

description:
The Happy Hour is an amazing value at 50% off, but the food isn't special. With 5 family members, we ordered by elimination--got everything but the caesar. The bacon-cheddar "tater tots," which sound like terrible bar food, were actually creamy mashed potato croquettes, and were the stand out. The vegetarian chopped salad, of all things, was the next dish with a light but creamy buttermilk dressing. I found the pate too sweet, but everyone else liked it.

The Papas Bravas were lightly crispy on some edges, but the aioli was bland. The Garibaldi's namesake salad was a boring throwback: vinaigrette mixed greens with candied walnuts, bruised pear and blue cheese. The beets had a nondescript white sauce, and frisee that tasted like it had been tossed in a salt & oil dressing. At around $8, the burger is an absolute steal with fries and a salad's worth of mixed greens. The patty was perfectly medium and thick, but not particularly flavorful or tender, and served on a pretty tough bun. 

The Cucumber Martini, basically a gimlet, and the French 76 were tasty though uninspired. The Island Breeze, a vodka slap in the face with a little pineapple, was not.

At Super Duper prices, you get white tablecloth service from a wonderfully friendly bartender.
author: Laura S.

description:
My friend visiting from LA found Garibaldi's and to be completely honest, I had no idea where this was.  Not surprisingly, I don't really make it out here very often since coming out here feels like an excursion to New York. Ok not really, but you know what I mean.

Anyway, my party of three was cozied up by the window at our table and we spent our entire dinner laughing about things we used to do in college, things we're doing now, and things we're about to do.  We ordered the Burratta Mozzarella to start and conversed over a few cocktails (the Perfect Perfect Manhattan and the Cucumber Martini).  The cheese light and airy, and was a great dish to share.

We continued to talk and soon dinner came out.  We each ordered something different (as a Yelper, I find this to be the optimal situation), where we ordered the Seared Lock Duart Salmon, the Bucatini Pasta, and I had the Herb Roasted Chicken "Pascarella". I was seriously impressed with my chicken; most of the times you order a chicken dish, it's got a good possibility of coming out dry or boring.  Not this one. There was a little bit of a crust on the outside, and the inside was extremely tender!  I had a bite of my friend's Bucatini dish, and the rich cheese (presumably burratta) had me thinking that I should have had that instead.  Then I tried the salmon dish.  I'm actually not a fan of salmon.  In fact, I will usually tell someone that it's on my blacklist.  BUT, my friend offered up a piece of salmon that appeared to have crispy skin, and I reluctantly said OK.  The result? I couldn't be more impressed with how tasty the dish was! And while fish may not be my first choice, I was SERIOUSLY impressed with the dish.

I ate until I was relatively full, and then dessert was offered.  Garibaldi's offers Petite Sweets, where you basically get a small sized version so it makes it easy for us undecisive people and those of us that ate too much dinner.  We went with the Flourless Chocolate Cake and the Bananas Foster. The chocolate cake came with coffee ice cream and was beautiful, rich, and decadent.  The Bananas Foster was equally delicious with a wonderful crunchy topping in addition to the rich bananas.

Overall, dinner really impressed me.  It'd be a great place to take my parents to, it's definitely more of a "classic" fine dining place and not your standard super trendy restaurant that's popular in SF these days.  I would definitely like to bring my parents or in-laws here for dinner, I think they'd LOVE it!
author: Lisa I.

description: Restaurant week menu was great, and the service was excellent. I had the broccoli soup, lamb entree, and chocolate boudini for dessert. Only downside was that they ran out of bread!
author: Jasmine L.

description:
The short ribs were delicious, and when purchased with a voucher, reasonably priced. We went on a Friday night so the place was packed and very noisy. The tables are packed close together, which isn't surprising being in San Francisco. However, the couple next to us was trying to have a romantic moment and I felt like I was so close I was part of it. When you have to go to the bathroom, you have to squeeze through the tables and decide if you put your a$$ or front in someone's face. 
Good: super tasty food that isn't out of a pre-packaged box. 
Bad: a bit loud
author: Honest G.

description:
I used to live right by this place and never knew it was even there! love that it's tucked away and pretty low key. inside it's intimate, but still a little swanky.

As for our meal, we had the chicken milanese and the steak. both very good but, like a lot of the reviewers have mentioned, the chicken milanese was the winner here! We chose it based on yelp recommendations and it definitely lived up to it's expectations. Also the potato-sides that came with both dishes were very good.
author: Terra C.

description:
Great salad, limited selection for vegetarians though. Really enjoyed our meal, but still a little bit pricy. 

Pomegranate martini was wonderful. Desert was fabulous !
author: Jamie W.

description:
Garibaldi's is a great restaurant just happen to forget to go there when there are so many great new restaurants. It is the kind of restaurant I would say is like an old good friend....always consistent, dependable and good.

We went this weekend and the food and service was superb. Started with a trio of apps: The "papas bravas quebradas (amazing potatoes in a wonderful sauce),risotto croquettes(wonderful crunchy balls of rice goodness), and slow roasted carrots ( tender marinated in lemon honey and yougurt)....all of these were gone soooo quickly.

I must admit the Cesar salad was pretty week...but the steak tartare was stellar as was the potato soup which was vegan but had tons of flavor!

 The main courses were as usual tasty and plentiful the roasted pork with the belly was great...loved the spetzel with it. The lamb which is a classic here was phenomenal, and for the one vegetarian in the family the bucatini "puttanesca without the shrimp was fantastic.

The deserts were okay not great but soo soo.

Overall this is a great date place, and great place for for a party of 4 ...but no more as it is on the small side.

Go ahead treat yourself to presidio height"s finest!
author: David G.

description:
Enjoyed a fantastic evening here.

My client/friend treated me to dinner here recently and I'm ever so glad they did.

We arrived around 6:30 and the place was already fairly packed, leaving no tables available other than previous reserved tables. However, the open bar area had several tables available that ended up accommodating us perfectly.

This place is fabulously chic, and impeccably designed. Intimately, sultry color scheme streamlined throughout, mirrored walls, romantically dimmed lighting...just absolutely stunning.


We started off the evening with a bottle of Gundlach Merlot. This wine was exquisitely superb in taste,  setting off the evening on a good note, and carrying on to be a great companion to our main dishes.

For appetizers, we went with the Grilled Monterey Calamari. This starter was presented beautifully, and absolutely exceptional in taste. The calamari was cooked to perfection, delicately drizzled with an out of this world aioli.
