The combination of everything drew me to the conclusion that it was probably the best calamari I have ever had. We both agreed it was stellar

For our main dishes -by recommendation of the server as well as our own contemplation , we went with the Marinated Lamb Tenderloins. It comes with couscous mixed with dried cranberries, pistachios and drizzled in a Tarragon sauce. This dish also arrived beautiful in presentation and quite plentiful. The lamb was cooked to a tender perfection ( medium rare) just how we requested.  As far as the flavoring of the dish , as well as the bed of couscous concoction the lamb was laid upon, I would say it was just OK. Couscous was flavored decently however, I felt it was just slightly too dry. I also wasn't completely sold on the tarragon sauce the Lamb came accompanied with. Neither of us were crazy about it. The dish was good, just not as spectacular as we were anticipating it to be.

We finished off the evening by sharing a Pumpkin Cheesecake dessert. The presentation was slightly sloppy however, taste and consistency wise, it was rich, decadent, and sinfully delicious.

Service we received from our server was very professional as well as genuine and friendly. 

Overall, I absolutely love the classy romantic atmosphere. The service was genuine and accommodating. And though the lamb was not quite  the shining star of the evening, it was still delectable cooked with everything else being exceptionally winning in taste and execution. I would love to return again : )
author: Shannon H.

description: Order the Chicken Milanese! My husband recommends the halibut. Nice date night or group celebration. Great cocktails. Spotty service.
author: Vicki L.

description:
So happy to have finally discovered Garibaldi's! Hidden away in the beyond charming, Presidio Heights, which literally might be Paris in disguise, Garibaldi's is the perfect dinner spot.

Not only is their food great, but their menu is structured in a way that encourages you to try as many of their dishes as possible. Rather than just getting one appetizer, or one dessert, you can instead try 2, or 3, or 4 smaller portions! Why doesn't every restaurant offer this??!!

For appetizers, we got the papas bravas, risotto croquettes, and brussel sprouts. All three were delicious but the papas were definitely our favorite. Crispy, flavorful and plentiful- these were definitely a unique take on the classic Spanish dish.

For mains, we shared their special pappardelle pasta and the chicken Milanese. The chicken was good but nothing mind-blowing, but the pasta was fantastic. Handmade thick noodles spread with a juicy ragu, these were delectable. 

Finally, we shared two desserts: the peanut butter sundae and the chocolate cake/budino. Whatever it was exactly, it was amazing, as was the peanut butter sundae. I would go back to garibaldi's every night just for dessert.

If you're ever looking for a great date spot in a new area, definitely try out Garibaldi's. They always seem to be busy, so make a reservation!
author: Rachel L.

description:
The Risotto Croquettes were cheesy and crispy, just as I had hoped. The Bucatini Pasta was fantastic. The pork ragu was incredible and rich. I would come back just for these two plates. The chicken and filet mignon also looked excellent and got great reviews.

Great little spot in the hood.
author: Derek S.

description: I really enjoyed this place! My favorite part about it would have to be that cool burger they had which was so delicious even with the dijon mustard! I couldn't even eat all my french fries because i was so full after that! I definitely suggest you should check this place out some time soon as it's really good quality food!
author: Asher D.

description:
i came here for a group dinner over the wknd.  we got the round table in the corner, which was nice, but it was super squishy.  

we shared a bunch of apps, and they were all good...the brussels sprouts and patatas bravas particularly.  the bread w/ warm oil and olives was also really tasty.

then the entrees came, which were not as good.  i had the halibut, which was delish, but i shared the mussels w/ my friend, and they were overcooked and fishy.  for dessert, we had the chocolate budino (super rich), sorbet, and the meyer lemon panna cotta.  

service could have been better.
author: Helen T.

description: If you're looking for small portions of carelessly cooked but pretentiously arranged food, this is the place for you. I dropped over $70 before tip on a 3-course meal for one last night that had to be the least satisfying in my 10+ years of living in and around San Francisco. A buffalo mozzarella salad appetizer that consisted of a few shreds of the cheese, lots of over spiced marinara sauce and oily dried breadcrumbs? A salmon entree that was small, overcooked and arranged on top of grain stuffed with sour lemon slices? How do they manage to stay in business in this highly competitive food town?
author: Richard J.

description:
One of the best meals I've had in a long time! I went here with my boyfriend on a Friday night around 9pm or so. (They are open until 10:30 on the weekends, which is very nice.) The atmosphere is nice and a good place for a date. There was no wait given that we arrived so late.

We started w/ the burratta mozzarella salad, it was amazing. The cheese and tomatoes were both delicious. We also got the melone pazzo (meh) and the risotto croquettes (so good!). For an entree, per the other Yelp reviews, we split the chicken milanese. It did not disappoint! The breading was light, and the chicken itself was very moist. For dessert, we got two of the "petite" choices, which, in fact, were not small at all! They are quite big. We could have gotten one and just split it.
author: Bonnie G.

description: The food at garibaldi's is so delicious. The risotto was just 'Food nirvana'. Lots of options for vegetarians in the small plates category, the Brussels sprouts are amazing. I am writing this review while I wait for my dessert ... lol
author: Nachiket K.

description: Upon entering the establishment you notice the typical 25-feet wide by 125-feet deep modern restaurant with a full bar at the right, white table cloths, and large bouquets of fresh flowers gently lit. Merry Edwards Sauvignon blanc with Papas Bravas and Halibut & Calamari Ceviche pairs very well and also compliments the Garibaldi Salad. This place is great for small plates and myriad of wines or order the dinner plates of short ribs, rib-eye, or halibut and the evening cannot go wrong. It's also a great place to bring one one for their birthday. Thanks for a wonderful evening of food and drinks Garibaldi. We'll be back.
author: Gina A.

description:
The cocktails are pricey, but very good.  Dinner was delicious: I can recommend all the dishes we had: mussels, lamb tenderloins, and tagliatelle (comes with meatballs).  The bread with warm olive dip was also lovely.  No room for dessert, but it was worth it to try as many dishes as we did.
Service was not great. Everyone was nice, which in my book is the most important thing, but the server didn't seem that well trained.  To her credit, she was trying to be fast, but that caused her to not listen and subsequently screw up a few things.  The busboy actually seemed to have the most professional training, e.g., knew exactly when to clear dishes and serve more water.
Definitely recommend.
author: JJ M.

description: I don't usually eat in Pacific Heights, and Garibaldis was a lovely surprise!  I had made a reservation and they seated us promptly. Our server was wonderful - giving us time when we needed it and making wonderful recommendations on everything - they have a great un-oaked Chardonnay, delicious halibut, expertly fresh and refreshing kale.  I'm not usually a big potato person, but my boyfriend ordered the papas which were an amazing combination of crispy, savory, with the heaviness cut with a great sprinkling of chives. All the dishes and the service was impeccable. We will be back!
author: Kathryn C.

description: A nice, special occasion restaurant.  I ordered the tagliatelle with rabbit and enjoyed it.
author: Jennifer N.

description: We ordered from the SF Restaurant Week menu--it's a great deal and offers some of their best menu items. But, I do want to note that everything on their regular dinner menu was reasonably priced and I would definitely come back again and pay the full price for everything we ate. We  had the Risotto Croquettes and Garibaldis Salad to start. We ordered the Cioppino and Chicken Breast Milanese. And had Profiteroles and the Chocolate Budino for dessert. Everything we had was very flavorful and prepared perfectly. Our server was incredibly sweet and attentive. Dinner went very smoothly--just the right amount of time between ordering drinks and food, check-ins from the server, refills, etc. We never felt rushed and never felt like we were left waiting too long. It was honestly pretty perfect. It can get a little loud when the restaurant is full but otherwise the ambiance is great--a little small, but great for an intimate dinner or a small gathering of friends.
author: Leanne V.

description: I love the small, local feel of this restaurant.  I particularly love the Chicken Milanese, served with mashed potatoes and salad.  It's boneless pounded chicken coated in bread crumbs and then fried - yum.  If you like sitting at the bar as I do, all the staff is wonderful, but my favorite is Melissa, both for her impeccable service and her intelligent conversation.
author: Deirdre G.

description:
This deserves 3.5 stars.  Too bad we can't give halves.   

First impression : Posh and fancy.  I think Garibaldi is trying to catch up with its nearby competitor Spruce that holds a Michelin star.

I came here for dine about town 2013 with a group of my girlfriends. The place was pretty busy but the staff was very polite and sweet.  I had the chickpea salad with scallions , (I believe it was....) Mahi Mahi with squash and Sorbet for dessert.  The dishes were pretty big and filling.  Everything was decent but nothing was extraordinary.  It was a good meal - Not a "wow, this is fantastic!" meal.  Hard to say.  But because the staff was so friendly and kept trying to help us take a "perfect" picture with the dim lighting, I give them an extra half of a star.  

Good normal date spot with someone you've just met and aren't sure about yet.
author: Shirley T.

description: A super pleasant place for lunch. I loved the butternut squash soup. Salmon salad was less dazzling. Good service and nice experience.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Very pricey. You're much better off going to the Elephant Bar,where you get better food and will save around $50 on a dinner for two.
The ambiance is crowded and very loud....the restaurant is packed with SF socialites and the tables are spaced practically on top of each other.
I ordered a $12 drink and it was 95% ice cubes and considerably watered down. Dinners are a la carte and the portions are small.
author: Ike S.

description:
Suffering from our long haul flight, our first night's choice wasn't a bad one at all.  I give my self a pat on the back for picking this one.  

Handing for this part of town.  Looks like it is popular with the locals as we managed to get the last availible table at that time and we didn't book!

Food was tasty - the burrato and tomatoes were delicious.  I had pasta and that was good too.  We just had water as that old jet lag was making us slightly rocky!  

The place seemed to be buzzing so a good choice to start off with!
author: Emma W.

description: Favorite for locals - and for good reason.  Consistently great food and service!   One of the best neighborhood restaurants in San Francisco - been around for over 25 years.
author: David F.

description: I really liked this place... delicious food, good space, the service was great but nothing standout -- it was a bit crowded but we were seated right away. I wouldn't say it's one of my top favorite restaurants in the city but I would be back which is saying a lot given all the choices these days!
author: Nolan M.

description: Great little restaurant. The food was amazing! We came in around 9pm for dinner and the place was packed with locals. We were seated right away. Wait staff was spot on with service. We closed the place down and they came and sat with us for a glass of wine. Really had a nice evening. Good place for a date. No too romantic but elegant. Dress to impress or upscale casual.
author: Kim B.

description: Dinner was good.  The chocolate budino was one of the best desserts I've had in my life!
author: Laurie R.

description:
great environment

ribeye and taglietelli (sp?) were delicious
author: Jon K.

description: While I don't think Garibaldi's performs quite at the level of Spruce it's far less stuffy, the type of neighborhood restaurant where you can take someone special and not feel like you're going too over the top. I never regret ordering the grilled calamari appetizer or the bucatini con gamberi (shrimp, basil, cherry tomatoes, oyster mushrooms). They offer corkage for $15 (if my memory serves me correctly), so feel free to bring your favorite bottle with you. Service is always warm.
author: Jeremy S.

description: Had lunch there today.  Had their fried chicken salad which had the most delicious and moist chicken. Finished with a mini peanut butter sundae.   Everything tasted delicious and the service was friendly and efficient.   Would love to go back if I was in their neighborhood.
author: Madhuri K.

description:
Wow, this place is a hidden gem. After searching on Yelp for restaurants around my office, Garibaldi's came up as one of the "nicer" restaurants in the area. I made a reservation for 6:30pm and walked over from my office. BF was LATE. Parking is impossible (as I told him before he decided to circle). I told him to valet. We were about 20 mins late but they still kept our table and sat us. 

Their cocktail list is impressive. We decided to "share" because again, my bf thinks my eyes are bigger than my stomach. Sometimes a girl just wants her own dish! We shared the blood orange salad. AMAZING. Came with slices of onions, blood orange, arugula and avocado. So fresh and light. We also shared the Italian meatballs which were also delicious. We chose the salmon as our entree. I really like it when restaurant split the dish onto 2. I dislike the times where I feel like a vulture picking at 1 plate. 

The dessert, my friends, is the best part. The profiteroles were amazing! They had just put it on the menu the previous night and so far were a hit. Let me tell you...they were the best I have ever tasted in my life. 

I will definitely come back. This is a hidden gem in Laurel Heights. It is definitely not a quite place. A lot of the "Heights" people dine here. Expect the old money to roll in here.
author: Katie Anne N.

description: I visited Presidio Heights shopping area recently and had my lunch at Garibaldi's. Excellent food - the taste, the presentation all very good. I need to come back for their happy hour!!!
author: Arnika Z.

description: Wine service is not professional and rushed. Really bad knowledge of how to serve wines.  We dined here for dinner, and we bought in a nice bottle of wine for corkage (the bottle was 16 years old. It retailed  for $110, 16 years ago. California Cabnernet, bordeaux-style blend).  The server, Jeff, rushes to open the bottle without even looking at it. We asked him to decant it since it is 16 years old, and with an annoyed look, he rushes to the back with the bottle without saying anything.  He then comes back with the wine in a decanter and plops the decanter in the middle of the table. He doesn't say a word, and he doesn't pour the wine.  He discarded our bottle and cork in the garbage for a wine that we had been laying down in our cellar for over 10 years.  We wait.  The wine sits in the middle of our table.  He comes back, takes the order, begins other service, and still leaves the wine on the table. He doesn't offer to pour at all. So, we have to pour the wine ourselves into our glasses. I have never, ever had this happen in a restaurant.  He never refills the glasses from the decanter.  We have to do the entire wine service ourselves for the entire meal.  Had we not poured the wine ourselves, that entire decanter of wine probably would have sat in the middle of the table the entire meal.  This is unprofessional and unacceptable in any any restaurant in San Francisco, but especially one that is in Presidio Heights, where the clientele is extremely knowledgeable in wines.  The staff at this restaurant needs to understand that people in SF take their wines very seriously, and that they need to treat the wine experience just as well as the food experience. Wine and food are coupled together, and a strong wine experience complements the enjoyment of food. This is a fundamental concept that was truly lacking the evening we dined at Garibaldi's.  We hope the management will take some time to emphasize to their servers the importance of taking the wine service seriously and to train the staff in proper wine service.  This is important especially since some of the wines that are brought in for corkage can be quite valuable and hold sentimental value for their patrons.
author: Gunnar F.

description:
Not sure if Garibaldi's was having an off night, but my experience on Saturday was only "okay."

My friend and I had a res at 7:45. We sat down, reviewed the menu, and decided to start with a few apps, share a salad and share an entree. 

I ordered the chicken liver pate which was quite good despite the overly crunchy slices of toast that accompanied it. My friend ordered the risotto balls. She enjoyed them - they weren't my favorite. We proceeded to share the heirloom tomato salad with burrata cheese. The salad was good, though there was very little cheese. The disappointment came with the orecchiette. It was the most bland, boring pasta I think I've ever tasted. The vegetables were undercooked (undercooked eggplant is no bueno) and the squash blossoms were a strange addition. We actually had to send that back.

We finished the meal with a chocolate budino which was really only "okay." We didn't even eat half of it.

I've been to Garibaldi's for happy hour and really enjoyed it. I may need to give the restaurant one more chance, but with so many good restaurants in SF, it's hard to revisit a mediocre experience.
author: Carrie S.

description:
Fantastic service! Slow toasted carrots and potatos bravas and buccatini! Scallops!

The wine selection must have been one of the best I've ever seen. The waiter was sooooo attentive and was a fantastic sommelier, to boot. They let us stay there and didn't harass us by plopping the check down, until I asked. THAT is what is the difference (in my book) between 4 and 5 stars. We were having some emotional moments (none of your business) and maybe they sensed that. Again...that's why 5 stars. Oh, they have valet parking, but if you get there early enough, you'll have no prob parking around Presidio/Washington. 

I deem it a very, very classy neighborhood place. Perfectly worthy of 5 stars for any SF foodie!
author: Kevin F.

description:
We went to Garibaldi's last Friday around 8:45. We have made the reservation at the same day. The restaurant was completely full but we didn't have to wait for even a minute. The meals were delicious and such a grate ambiance. 
Although it's says 3 $$$ on yelp , it is more of a 4 $$$$ restaurant, but it worth it. 
We got the grilled calamari and a salad as staters. For me main course we had 2 different chicken dishes and everything made just grate. 
At the end we had the terminus Sunday. YAMI. 
I totally recommend that place.
author: Rita M.

description: Uninspired food mixed with poor service made for a sub-par meal. We sat in the back and were essentially forgotten. We had to get pretty pushy to order a drink and dinner, and the meals were just so-so. The whole evening was just a big disappointment.
author: Julie K.

description:
Tucked away in the Pac Height neighborhood.  Most of the patrons look like locals in the neighbhorhood.

Good food and large portions!

For appetizer:
- risotto croquets: ok not a big fan
- grilled calamari (not fried): very tasty 

For entrees:
- lamb 
- salmon
Both very good.
author: Thomas H.

description:
When a co-worker recommended Garibaldi's in Laurel Heights, I'll be the first to admit I was skeptical. This particular co-worker has "emotional ties" to this place...which means constant rave reviews. You know the "I swear this is the best thing you will EVER eat" and "I swear you'll find no better place" 

Now, you should know up front that A) In my experience, usually places and things never truly live up to the hype and B) I am not one to issue 5-star reviews often.

Other than the hostess, who wasn't the most friendly woman I've ever met, there is NOTHING about this place that I don't like!

The restaurant is swanky and chic, and the environment is all I'd want it to be. It's this terrific combination, of calm, energetic, and alive all in one. 

BEST ADVICE I CAN GIVE YOU: Go to Happy Hour! Their dishes are half off as our their drinks...This is UH-MAZE-ING!

I tried:

-Margaritas (these are solid, but these don't really contribute to my 5-star rating)
- Cavelli (OH MY GOD. THIS IS CRAZY STUPID GOOD! I SHOULD HAVE ORDERED ANOTHER 6 PORTIONS @ $6 happy hour price! You know how people ask, "If you were to die tomorrow, what would be your last meal on earth?" Umm- question ANSWERED! THIS DISH!)
- The bread they serve at the beginning of the meal is amazing.
-Toffee Pudding (Definitely tasty, but given dessert choices, this wouldn't be my first choice. My co-workers LOVED it!)
- Flourless chocolate cake with espresso ice cream and almonds (I just died and went to heaven!)

The waitstaff, bar tenders, manager, and executive chef all deserve a round of applause. I will certainly be back with family and friends! I can't wait to return!
author: Annalise F.

description:
Great, knowledgable waitstaff, a nice selection of wine and a delicious food!

We started with the grilled octopus and salads and enjoyed a selection of different entrees (I had the Bolognese pasta).  

Everything was fresh and delicious, as you would expect from a fine eating establishment.  The staff was at tentative and helpful in making recommendations - not simply steering us to the 'special' or the most expensive bottle of wine.

I have no reservations whatsoever either recommending Garbaldi's to a friend or returning next time I'm in SF.

Don't hesitate to try it out!
author: Matt S.

description:
You know what? this is the place you go for a date or to meet with a small group of friends if you are wanting amazing food, fantastic service and great atmosphere overall. The usual places in San Francisco have become such trendy spots with out of towners and tourists making it hard to get into. 

I have been here three times now, first time to take a girlfriend out for her birthday. Got a special table and learned how great their chopped salad and calamari appetizers are. The second time went with my boyfriend and another couple and it was fantastic. Had to order the brussel sprouts and lamb. This last time went with 3 other girlfriends and it was just amazing. Had the pork chop amongst the usual first course choices and it was so tasty, our waiter just attentive enough and overall a fantastic dinner.

I hope this place continues to do well while staying under the radar of visitors of our city!
author: Bee N.

description:
I cannot say enough amazing things about this place. With so many amazing restaurants in SF, it is quite difficult to stand out. But Garibaldi's does. 

Impeccable food, service, wine, & cocktails. I can't even talk about Garibaldi's without my mouth watering. Might seem pricey to some, but is worth every penny. The portion sizes are hefty in comparison to many of those new "trendy" SF spots.

After traveling outside SF for a few months, I'm not ashamed to admit I miss Garibaldi's most of all. Friends come and go, but Garibaldi's is forever.

Wish I was kidding, I TOTALLY love this place.
author: Lauren A.

description:
Once I walked into Garibaldi's I was ushered to the back of the restaurant, near the restrooms where no one else was sitting. There were plenty of tables in the front of the restaurant open (and people were eating there, too) but it looked like the front of the restaurant was reserved for individuals that were either over 30 or had a mortgage. Regardless, I sat at my table and glanced over the menu.

I honestly looked the menu up and down and could NOT find a single item that caught my attention. Being very unenthused about the meal about to come, I put my menu down and waited for a server to stop by my table. If you were wondering how long that took, it was about 15 minutes and that was probably because I was sitting in the back of the restaurant, next to the bathroom, like a child who lost his mother.

Enraged, I ordered pasta with some sort of cherry and meat sauce. I'm actually not sure what it was called, but that literally took 3 minutes for my food to arrive. Why didn't that take longer?  I bit into the food and I could instantly tell this meal had already been prepared and was reheated. I was then given my bread basket which was supposed to be placed on my table before the waitress arrived.

My meal was horrible and I couldn't even finish it. Garibaldi's prides itself on upscale dining but there was nothing fancy or respectable about this establishment.
author: Tommy C.

description: My husband and had a delightful experience when we came here for happy hour! The bartenders were super warm, attentive and friendly. They also poured strong cocktails, which enhanced our experience in a positive way! We tried the heirloom cucumbers and the burger off the happy hour menu. The burger was big and juicy - just how I like it! The heirloom cucumbers were awesome too!
author: Ellen P.

description:
Whenever I get stressed raising my 7 month old I think of my friend who has 2 year old twins AND a 2 month baby.  If there's anyone who deserves a night out...it's her! And so I told my friend to choose any nearby restaurant and she chose a scrumptious night out at Garibaldi's.

It just so happened it was our lucky night because they were participating in Dine About Town  I wasn't sure if I'd want to order from the special menu, but realized that all the best menu items were featured as part of Dine About Town so it made the most sense.

My friend and I both ordered the following (keeping it easy for our waiter):
* Glass of Sauvignon Blanc
* Garibaldis Salad
* Chicken Milanese served with Mashed Potatoes
* Sorbet

The salad and chicken were so scrumptious that I couldn't stop eating it even though I started to get ridiculously full. I tried to save room for the sorbet, but the honeydew flavor (ick) was disappointing anyway. Seriously...honeydew sorbet?

Towards the end of the meal we placed an order for a burger for my friend's better half (he was at home with the kiddies), but they forgot about it...and so we ended up having to wait awhile.  We didn't mind too much since it just extended our kid free night.
author: Andrea R.

description: We made a last minute reservation after a long day for both of us, while fighting traffic  heading home from the airport. Fortuitously, Garibaldi's had an opening for two and valet parking (we were in no mood to circle for a spot). Bonus: when we arrived, there were seats at the bar! We opened with cocktails with assistance from Martin the bartender (when I inquired about a bourbon as the base for a Manhattan, he had the perfect vermouth pairing for it), and it was awesome from then until we left. Five stars for service (Martin is a skilled, personable, professional bartender who was as helpful with wine as with the cocktails), drinks and food. We're definitely coming back!
author: A P.

description:
This is a hot spot for middle-aged mama's boys. Saw several here dining with their mothers. The one next us was decked out in country club casual, telling his momma about how it was hard to type on his new phone, which was called an iPhone, which had voice recognition, and the next one would be called iPhone X, like Generation X, to appeal to kids, and how he lived in a cave and just discovered technology. Believe it or not, I only made up that very last part. 

Firemen swarmed this place after our appetizers. I thought they would start playing stripper music.  No, it wasn't THAT kind of place. Some poor girl needed medical attention. Food allergy, perhaps. 

Onward!

FOOD:

The risotto croquettes and crispy pork belly were underwhelming. The croquettes are nothing new (I've had them at two other places). Pork belly was too sweet with the watermelon and was drowning in balsamic reduction.

For entrees, the Milanese chicken was little more than a glorified chicken fried steak. The rabbit pasta was most disappointing and reaffirms my belief that good Italian pasta is nearly impossible to find outside of the Mission, which is too far away from my neighborhood.  Sigh...first world problems.

SERVICE:

Energetic hostess holds down the fort out front. You can tell she earns her keep.  She let us know when our table was being set after they ran ~7 minutes late from our reservation with Savored (30% off!).

The waiter was nowhere near as impressive as the hostess. He poured my wine without speaking and dashed off. We hardly saw him. I don't like overly present waiters but I saw our waiter only when he silently put our dishes down. 

---

It's all relative. This place is a neighborhood joint (no one will -- nay, no one SHOULD -- go out of their way for this) and it does the job. I don't live in this neighborhood though, once at Garibaldi's will do.
author: Erika C.

description:
After seeing a movie around the corner we came here for a glass of wine and something light to eat.  We were greeted with a big smile by the hostess and seated at a table near the bar. Our friendly and engaging server came over to greet us immediately and offered up some great wines to taste when we had a question on which one to order. She went above and beyond and her recommendations were perfect. We both settled on a Malbec.

The food choices on the menu all sounded really interesting and I went with the herb chicken (bone-in) with brocolini & fennel. It was tasty and the portion size was more than generous.  My friend had a salad that looked really great too. Again, our server was knowledgeable about all the food menu items just as she was about he wine and clearly steered us in the right direction. 

If you want ambiance, stellar service, excellent food and an all around enjoyable place to dine, I highly recommend this place!
author: Rob L.

description: Stopped in for a drink and small plate at the bar. Super friendly bar tender, great small plates (poke and potatoes) and we were on our way. Will return for full on dinner.
author: Katie S.

description: Excellent service,  tasty chicken milanese,  wine and fabulous atmosphere. Would definitely recommend this place
author: Frances H.

description: Used to really like this place but I ate lunch here and was disappointed. It was very expensive and very little food (I had the chicken and faro salad).
author: K P.

description:
This is my favorite restaurant in the city! The service is on point from the moment you walk in the door. The hostess (or host) is always really friendly and when you sit at your table you are greeted almost instantly to start your dining experience. 

I have had many different things on the menu, it changes all the time (which is great) but my favorite is the cioppino. 

The atmosphere there can be a tiny bit loud but it is a great spot so it's almost always full. 

The dirty martinis (and wine selection) are awesome and they start your meal with different types of bread and a warm olive tapenade. That alone will make your night!

Highly recommend coming here even if you aren't in Pacific Heights, it's totally worth it!
author: Robyn M.

description:
Dined here prior to a speaking event at the JCC - they were great at acknowledging the start time of the event and getting us in and out to make it on time.  The orrichette with jalapeno pesto was amazing. I will definitely be back.

Parking is Pac Heights parking - challenging at best - but they do have valet.
author: Dawn S.

description:
The portions at the place are huge, but not in a way that makes you feel disgusted with yourself! Mostly because each ginormous bite is a delicious and perfectly crafted sculpture of gustatory delight.

Seriously.

I always get really excited when friends who live in Pac Heights/Laurel Heights haven't been here--it gives me an opportunity to be a know at all and take them to their new favorite place... And it's also an excuse to revisit one of my favorite dinner spots in the city.
author: Luz S.

description:
Chic restaurant in Laurel Heights
Great house bread basket: walnut, olive, sourdough
Full bar; excellent wines by the glass, but expensive
Happy hour & prix fixe dinner menus
Fantastic lamb salad; so-so steelhead corn dish
Fantastic desserts; try the chocolate budino
Good food service
Negative: linty napkins
author: Rosquete B.

description: One of my favorite places in SF! The risotto balls as an appetizer are to DIE for. I usually get the chicken milanese, which is unbeatable, but tonight i had to try their duck ragu pasta. So incredibly good. Everything about it was perfect. The pasta, the duck, the flavor. I wish there was one in southern california so I could go here more often but I guess i appreciate it even more having it far away. Their cocktails are amazing as well. Can't wait for dessert!
author: Alex E.

description:
I have eaten lunch at garibaldis with good results.on numerous occasions.
However I ate dinner there tonight and was a very unpleasant experience.I sat at the bar and Jenny was the bartender as well as server.I found her to be unattentive and hostile and acted put upon with small requests.She seems to do ok with couples where she perceives she will get a reasonable tip,loudly talking and seductive towards male customers.Frankly I think it's better to treat all customers the same with courtesy and respect
author: Victoria S.

description: Tried this place last night while visiting the City. Unique  menu with great wine selection. Large portions too. Will definitely be back when visiting Pacific Heights again.
author: Jon M.

description:
How unfortunate. My wife and I invited another couple to join us in SF for dinner this evening, we came from Novato, our friends from San Carlos. The only reason for our joining forces at Garibaldis was a generous offer through Travelzoo for a new restaurant that sounded wonderful online.

Good news was that the eating experience was as expected, very good, the bad news was after an otherwise wonderful culinary experience, when presented with the bill our waitress proceeded to school us on the proper use of the coupon and the fact that they were busy attending to others so we would have to wait while they figured out our bill.

Needless to say, I was embarrassed our friends had to endure the berating of the waitress and I was surprised as most all the diners were there this evening because of the promotion.

I had bought 2 of the promos as this was the maximum allowed and had hoped and planned to go back again soon, sadly this will not be the case as I have requested a refund for the unused voucher and will not return regardless how much I enjoyed the food.
author: Brad G.

description:
Delicious!  I had the Farmer's Market Menu and it was an awesome deal for a snazzy little spot in Laurel Heights.

Wild Arugula Salad - crispy laura chenel chevre (just the right amount of crispy goodness), mint, thyme, wildflower honey (added enough sweetness to seemingly plain greens).

Chicken Tangine - chicken was really tender and the sauce was not overbearing (not too salty).  I asked for extra bread and dipped like it was going out of style.

Chocolate Mocha Mousse with Italian Doughnut - pure awesomeness!  It was a little like pudding, a little like fluffy cake, and perhaps a little like heaven.  Okay, I exaggerate.  But it was pretty good ;)
author: Anh D.

description:
Came here for Dine about Town with my boyfriend. We made reservations about 2-3 days before hand which was a good idea because it was busy. 

First course started with risotto balls and a cucumber feta salad. Delicious! I couldn't stop eating the risotto balls and they give you about 5 so watch out don't fill up on those. Second course the main dish I got the chicken milanese which a lot of the other reviews talk about. OMG amazzzing. Let me tell you the portion is huge. I couldn't eat all of it, and got left overs. My boyfriend order the tuna which he devoured.

For dessert we got the sorbet which I'm not typically a sorbet lover but it was so fresh and clean. We also got the chocolate with coffee ice cream which was good but heavy.  

Cute place, in Laurel Heights/Presido area.
author: Jess O.

description:
I went there for happy hour Friday and it is seriously the best deal in town. The Garibaldi salad was great--gorgonzola cheese, candied pecans and peaches in salad greens. The small portion was just right as I also had the risotto croquettes. Those were a perfect balance of crunch on the outside and soft within. 

You would think happy hour drinks would be watered down but my margarita was served ad a martini and it was Plenty effective. The Mojito is not on the happy hour list but was worth the extra $. 

The wait staff and bartenders were both friendly and great at their jobs and I even got to say hello to the chef. Hi John!  I am definitely going again. This has date night with husband written all over it.
author: Teresa D.

description: NOT WORTH IT!  Food was not good, caesar salad was highly unremarkable, salmon was not cooked enough and was the smallest bit of fish I had ever seen .. wine was very expensive per glass... waitress was trying too hard to be "cool" --- ambiance not remarkable.  Won't be back again.
author: Janet L.

description:
This review is for lunch.

I have been here for a weekday lunch a few times and it makes for a great lunch if you are looking to splurge a bit.

Lunches usually are not super crowded and the lunch menu has some definite highlights. My favorite is the grilled cheese and soup of the day. The soup is always on point.
author: Andrea S.

description: Love this neighborhood gem. I have dined here multiple times, both with friends and family, and have never been disappointed. Great cocktails and food, which they make easy to share so you can try multiple items. Reservations recommended for weekend nights.
author: Lauren C.

description: Garibaldi's feels like the little adorable Italian family you wish you had grown up with a gourmet twist. I had the herb roasted chicken pascarella, which was great. Both my parents really enjoyed the meal as well. Also, Garibaldi's is a place where they don't skimp on portions, so come hungry.
author: Christina H.

description: Fun and reliably delicious.  Try everything on the menu!  You can't go wrong! Very special neighborhood restaurant and hang-out.  Intimate.  French champagne.
author: Paula M.

description: This is must for date night in the city. It's not downtown, so more parking plus they have valet. But more importantly the food is exquisite. The ambiance is nice but gets a little loud. I've ordered a few things but the breaded chicken is a must. With the best mashed potatoes of your life. The drinks are fabulous and delectable. The service is great. This place is also great for a work meeting for lunch.
author: Sam W.

description:
Garibaldi's is in a great location.  We were in town for the Hong Kong Film Festival and wanted a place that was close to the theater.  It was within stone-throwing distance which made this place extremely desirable.

Service was prompt and courteous.  We arrived around 5:30 PM on a Sunday which meant that most reservations were not in just yet.  We were seated and drinks started.

We started off with anti pasties of the Tuna Meatballs and Roasted Brussels sprouts. Both were tasty, the tuna meatballs were a little dry, but the sauce on the tomatoes and greens for it were delicious. The Brussels were as one would hope for them to be--al dente and lightly seasoned.

For entrees, one of the party members had the filet mignon, two of the other party members had the braised beef short ribs, one other member had the pork chops, and I had the pasta.  I can only comment on the pork chops and pasta as I did not try the others.

The pork was quite tender and juicy, which is a surprise as I have had dry pork chops all too often.  The peach glaze was also very delicious.  The only thing was that there was too much pork chop--if that is even possible.  My husband can usually down a 18 oz steak from Alexander's Steakhouse, but was defeated by their pork chop dish.

For me, I had the pasta which was rather plain, but after the heavy appetizers, I wanted something nice and light.

Overall, great atmosphere and courteous wait staff.  I enjoyed my time at Garibaldi's.
author: Renee Y.

description:
Delicious meals, comfortable ambience! 

I went here for a graduation dinner with my mom, who has pretty high dining expectations. She was not disappointed! The server recommend a smooth red wine, and I had an amazing pasta, while my mom order the chicken. We were both very happy with our meals. 

Definitely worth checking out! I would make a reservation early, it gets crowded quickly on weekends.
author: Kathryn D.

description: First impressions were that the host bypassed us because the people behind us must have been regulars.  Then he tried to give us a table stuck in the corner. Things looked up after that and our server was delightful. The food was good although we are New Yorkers and you can't compete with our Italian. Overall, good.
author: Larry A.

description: This is my new favorite spot to dine in SF! Came here for a late dinner on a Saturday night and it was packed! Great service and ambiance-- plus the food is amazing! Every plate comes out hot and is prepared with care. The menu has a wide range of plates and interesting appetizers to choose from. The desserts are also incredible. This spot looks unassuming when driving by, but the moment you walk in, it is alive! What a great spot!
author: Katherine H.

description:
The food was really worth only 2 stars.  The hostess was horrible - take off one more star.  The waitress was unbelievably good - add a star back on.  So they canceled each other out.  

Our hostess was cold, unsmiling, and unhelpful.  We had a reservation, yet it took them almost 20 minutes to seat us.  Hello?  10 minutes, I could understand.  But 20?  What are reservations for?

Our waitress was a complete 180 from the hostess.  She was probably the best waitress ever (and I told her so).  My friend sent back her dish 'cause she didn't like it - yet our waitress said: "No problem.  You're here because you didn't want to do dishes tonight.  I'm here to make sure you're completely happy with your meal."  WOW.  I was floored.  On top of that, she was very helpful in recommending dishes.  I love waiters/waitresses with an opinion!
author: Kristen S.

description:
No one selects a sit down restaurant for its speed, but  if you are going to Garibaldis mid-evening, bring patience. Expect to wait at the small bar area and again at the table. A clever waiter might have suggested appetizers, offering a heads up, warning seriously hungry guests that the wait could be long. We got a disappointing breadbasket with one piece of artisan bread and a cut up baguette. 

As for our meals, they were delicious, as was the wine. Yes, that rescued the evening, but I couldn't help feeling something here just wasn't functioning well.  A terrific chef using high quality ingredients in a lovely white-tablecloth setting should result in a five star experience.  There is something missing...
author: Lynn S.

description:
I read on Yelp that the risotto croquettes were the way to go. I ordered those and a pear/Gorgonzola salad. I was a bit disappointed with the croquettes. They tasted like mozzarella sticks you'd buy at the grocery store but with Garibaldi's sauce on them. Not bad, but not great. 

Pear/Gorgonzola salad was also good but nothing special. Maybe I just ordered wrong. 

Jeremy, the bartender, was great. He made me the best Pimm's cup I've ever had! I liked the ambience - nice but not stuffy at all. I'd go back, but would order differently.
author: Robert P.

description: Great happy hour with half-price drinks and appetizers! The happy hour is from 5-6:30 and the small bar area was full up before 5:30, so get there early to enjoy it. I really liked their sangria with lots of fresh fruit. Favorite dishes include the fried brussels sprouts (we got two orders for three people!), chicken liver pate, and risotto croquettes. The grilled calamari was also quite good, and as we were leaving we saw someone order the cavatelli which looked delicious as well -- next visit!
author: Shing H.

description:
Garibaldi's is one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. It has a very small, intimate, New York-like vibe and it's a nice break from my usual Cheesecake Factory feedings.

I've had (and loved) their braised beef ribs and the milanese chicken breast, I definitely recommend both. It's not such a feat in a place like San Francisco, but I also really enjoyed their specialty cocktails. I liked the Basil Capirinha.
author: Gary M.

description: Great spot with history, local haunt.  Classy neighborhood, old school theater across the street.  The ceviche is very good, garibaldi's salad delicious. Everything seemed fresh and good presentation.  I'd definitely go again, although probably not a place I'd go way out of my way for like a Spruce, but very good.  If you're in the neighborhood, give it a try.  Feels like an oldschool SF place in a good way.
author: T B.

description: I went with Friends for Restaurant week! I did not eat, only accompanied a few great and dear friends during my quick visit to San Francisco for Business! I asked the lady up front if she could find a place for me to charge my phone and she took the phone into the back office and charged it with a big smile on her face. Very cool! Grat little gem of a restaurant! The wine was awesome (1 glass only) I did try one of the desserts and I believe it was a signature dessert for the restaurant and it was amazing! I can't wait to go back and eat dinner!
author: Rick F.

description:
Very nice restaurant!  I went here recently with a large group.  It was early in the evening and they seated us right away in the back where we could have a little more privacy.  

They set out olives and olive oil along with a variety of rolls to whet our appetites as we perused their wine list and personalized menus.  They seem to cater to groups because the menus greeted our group personally and included a selection of soup or salad, main entree, and dessert.  

My salad of fresh greens with gorgonzola and pear slices with a basalmic vinaigrette was tasty.  I had the seared blue nose sea bass with israeli couscous and asparagus and lemon-shallot vinaigrette.  The chocolate budino for dessert was basically a warm chocolate cake with espresso ice cream, caramel sauce, and pralines.  It was very rich, deliciously topped off the meal, and served for individuals, but could definitely be shared.  I had to walk up the hill back to my hotel to burn off the calories.   

The service was lovely and attentive and fast despite our large group.  The atmosphere was upscale.  Either I'm coming from Boston where people don't dress up much or I just don't eat out at fancy places.  Could be a little of column A and a little of column B.  It is a place I would consider dining at again, especially if I don't have to pay for myself!
author: May N.

description:
Solid four stars.

Go there for the authentic pasta.

Go there for the wine.

Go there for classy ambiance.

Go there for the retirement community clientele.
author: Mike G.

description: The food is decent but the service is slow and not-so-friendly.  I work close-by and have been here many times for work lunches.  Always the same story, decent food, but slow or bad service.  I was finally prompted to write a review today because one of the wait staff actually ROLLED HIS EYES today when I asked him if I could get my leftovers to-go.  There were four of us dining together and all of us were left eyeing one another upon this man's eye roll.  To be fair, he wasn't our waiter, he was the bus-boy, or equivalent, but seriously?  Rolling your eyes at a group of diners for a simple, common request?  Why should I pay to eat out and be treated like that...?
author: Jo M.

description: Garibaldi's was recommended to me by a friend so we checked it out. We were very happy with the food. We had the beet salad and chicken with rosemary entree. The food presentation was beautiful. Chicken was tasty and moist. No complaints. The restaurant itself is a bit tiny and cramped, but I guess that is part of the SF way. I would go here again and definitely would recommend it to friends and family. It helped that we walked here. As usual parking would probably be a nightmare.
author: Suzanne B.

description: Went there with my husband and his co-worker and we were really happy with our experience. We started with the Patatas Bravas which were excellent. We then all split the Lamb, Duck Orchiette Pasta, and the Chicken Milanese and we were very happy with our selections. I generally do not eat Lamb and found myself eating my entire portion. For dessert we had the Profiteroles which were also really great. My only complaint would be that we sat in the back and it was very hot there on an abnormally hot day in SF. The waiters were very attentive and helpful and steered us in the right direction for our order. We will definitely be back!
author: Paty H.

description:
This place is popular amongst the locals, and I can see why. Tucked away in the affluent Pacific Heights, this charming restaurant offers great tastes set in a trendy dimly lit space great for a romantic date or nice candle lit, white table clothed dinner with friends or family. Believe it or not, we came in with a Travelzoo voucher that we had purchased earlier that entitled us to two antipastis and two entrees.

I have to admit I was a little wary about any restaurant luring customers in with Travelzoo deals at it makes you wonder about the quality of the food, service, or any other factor that could result in a bad meal. I was proved wrong...the food and service was amazing.

The menu has a wide array of selection with rich and bold flavors and hearty portions. Notable items on the menu included the filet mignon which was cooked to perfection (so juicy and tender) served with delicious fingerling potatoes that were fried to perfection. Start that off with the Garibaldi's salad served with sweet lettuces, gorgonzola, spiced walnuts, nectarine, and a delicious white balsamic vinaigrette and you'll have yourself a perfect pairing. And while it was not included in the Travelzoo deal, we splurged on dessert and got 2 petite dessert items that were topped with their homemade ice cream (espresso and peanut butter to be exact).

The Travelzoo deal sounded to good to be true, and as it turned out the bill turned out to be more than we expected. Their system has a weird way of calculating the bill based on the Travelzoo discount so it wasn't exactly clear what was taken off the bill as it related to the Travelzoo discount. When we left the restaurant, the numbers still weren't adding up in our heads, but we left with a good meal so we decided to let it slide. On the way home, I got a call from the manager stating apologizing that they miscalculated our bill and missed a step in the discount process. Turns out our instinct in miscalculation was correct and they missed a step in the discount process. They kindly credited my card for the money that they didn't take out of the bill and apologized for the inconvenience. In any other circumstance, the confusion would have bothered me and make me think twice about getting another Travelzoo deal and/or coming back to Garibaldi's, but the fact that they called me back to acknowledge their mistake and apologize makes it all better. Great way to take ownership.

Moral of the story...don't judge a restaurant by it's Travelzoo and when in doubt, calculate your check to make sure it's actually a deal. Thanks for the deal Garibaldi's and for a delicious meal! We'll be back--deal or no deal!
author: Andrew S.

description: Ambiance was key, dim lighting and lively.  Food was excellent, had the Halibut.  I HIGHLY recommend the Mushroom appetizer-super delish!
author: K B.

description:
Garibaldi's is in a great restaurant to get nice casual dinner with some really great entree selections.  

I had the little gem lettuce salad, with avocado, picked veggies (?), and poppy seed dressing.  Very fresh ingredients, the added fat (good fat) from the avocado really made this salad for me.  It was definitely not your boring salad, with just lettuce, veggies, and dressing.  The fresh pasta ragu was good.  It was just a bit watery from the pasta water, but still tasty.  The olive oil cake was delish!  It was served with somewhat preserved apricot, that was spiked with rosemary, topped with lemon yogurt sorbet, and finished with some more olive oil.  I'm not a huge dessert fan, but it was delicioso!  

I'm definitely going back to Garibali's to try some of the other items like the grilled calamari appetizer and the bucatini with shrimp.
author: Wendy S.

description: One of the best meals I have had in recent months bar none!  Highly recommend the octopus and the lamb shank.
author: A D.

description: This neighborhood gem has changed quite a bit in the last few years. On a recent visit for lunch, I noticed the chef removed the best thing on the menu - lamb tenderloin salad. The rest of the menu was meh. I had a salad with fried pieces of chicken that seemed more appropriate at McDonald/s than an upscale restaurant. I also went for dinner one evening and was displeased to find that they no longer serve the delicious bread and warm olives that everyone loves. One now has to "request bread" - how cheap is that of the owner? They did have lamb on the menu so I ordered it but that too has changed - no cous cous - no delicious beans - broccoli which did not complement the dish at all. I am sad that the owner is ruining the menu and the experience. The waiters are lackluster these days  - they remove plates before all guests are done - seriously? I thought that was waiter 101 - do not touch plate till all diners have completed meal!!! Train the waiters and bring back the delicious food that used to be on the menu.
author: Ann W.

description:
Service was awesome, nice quiet place in a nice neighborhood. Food was OK.
I ordered the chicken sandwich which the waiter described as faboulous and it wasn't. Soup of curry and coconut was good. Food nothing out of the ordinary with limited selection.
author: L M.

description: My wife and I recently went to Garibaldi's for dinner before a talk at the JCCSF - it really is the perfect location to dine if you are attending an event there. Our experience was just about perfect - they make a great cocktail, the appetizers are delicious and our meal was excellent. We did have some mix-ups with food delivery and folks should be aware that this is a pricey place, but overall we were very pleased with our experience.
author: Lauren C.

description:
I had high hopes for this place. 

Let me start off by saying that if it was based on service, this would get 5 stars. The servers and hostess were wonderful and attentive. 

The atmosphere was alright:  dim/dark, louder than I'd expect, a small place with lots of people. 

The food was okay. Some were hits, others were misses.

For a party of 3 we had the following:

Brussel sprouts and chicken pate for appetizers. The sprouts were kind of charred, but okay. The bitterness was slightly diffused by roasted bell peppers, but not enough. The pate was okay, something I'd expect. 

For a starter, we only ordered one item: the Ricotta Mint Cavatelli. This was really good actually. And with the small appetizers, it was perfect to share between 3 people. 

For the mains:
1) Chicken Milanese - really well cooked, seasoned, and paired with mashed potatoes and arugula salad. I'm a fan of this dish.

2) Grilled Filet Mignon - It was okay. It was cooked to the proper medium-rare temperature, but was still a bit more chewy than expected. It was under-seasoned. The sides were fine, nothing to rave about. 

3) The honey maple brined pork chop - the porkchop itself was decently cooked and a large size. It was tough to cut though. The texture while eating was fine. The taste was overwhelmingly sweet. I expected it to be somewhat sweet, but it went overboard. Overall, an okay porkchop. The sides: the pumpernickel spraetzel (sp?) tasted and felt like a scrambled pancake. The turnips and carrots were underseasoned. Overall, a let down of a dish. 

I don't regret coming here, and I'm glad I tried it.  Would I come back again? I don't know. Maybe for a glass of wine and a good starter. Although I'd prefer to try out new places before coming back here again. Overall, an okay experience.
author: Katia T.

description:
This was our belated valentines day dinner.

We live 5 mins from here yet we had never visited until last night. Well that was stupid! I've been missing out on this amazing place all these years!! 

The drinks were delish! Nice strong and tasty! I had the pear tree and j had a kettle one martini. They give u some bread with these olives in oil. OMG. I could drink it. So good. So flavorful. 

J ordered the calamari and I the chicken liver pate for appetizer. I love pate!! This one was good too but the flavor wasn't so strong. It came with thin crispy buttered toasts. It was really good. J like his calamari too. I had a taste of the white beans that it came with. They were good. I ordered the lamb tenderloin and j got the filet mignon. My lamb was so freaking good!!! I couldn't even pay any attention to j's dinner. The lamb was so delicate and tender. It came with 3 pieces of lamb and was on top of some green beans and couscous which I also loved. J said his filet was amazing too. I was way full but for dessert j order a coffee and the dual sorbet. Yum!! It was a guava plus a mango and a shortbread on the side. 

I love this place and will definitely come back. The food and service amazing! 

My only complaint was that I felt a bit crowded. The tables are kinda close together. But that won't stop me from coming back!
author: Winnie Y.

description:
I wish I could agree with the rest of you, maybe I ordered the wrong items, but maybe they shouldn't put subpar items on the menu.
I started with the rice balls which are good but nothing worth writing about. Then I had the tuna.  It was awful!  I took one bite and could barely choke it down.  2 chunks of tuna in a bowl, covered in a white sauce and had everything leftover in the kitchen piled on top!  Croutons, tons of various colors of overcooked cauliflower, dates, pomegranate, ewwwh!  The flavors not only did not complement one another but blended to a cloud of the most obnoxious smell.  
My table mates had the lamb, the scallops and the chicken all okay but overpriced.
I'd give just one star but for the staff.  Very good service.
author: Dena M.

description:
Updating this review since it has been a year from the unfortunate incident.  We have returned several times and it's all good.  I agree with another reviewer that the prices are tad high, but consider the neighborhood.  Presdio Heights.  (If you don't like the prices here, just go down the street to Spruce where ALL the money hangs out.)

Still he happy hour is outstanding and the food is  good.  Some of the wait staff are great.  The bartenders are excellent.  I think it is an unfortunate policy that they only do the happy hour in the very small bar area, but it is a really good deal.  The service is spotty.  Sometimes great, sometimes not.  Try the happy hour and the happy hour menu.  It's fun for an early dinner.
author: Ralph B.

description: The spicy chicken salad is great: full of fresh veggies, cilantro and small slices of spice fried chicken breast, topped with almonds. The chocolate budino looks like a thing of beauty but I resisted trying it to avoid bulges in my bikini. Will go back to try it in a couple of months. ;)
author: yvette l.

description:
Very good food!
Recommend: Crispy Herbed Goat Cheese, Chicken Milanese and all the desserts! My favorite: Profiteroles. 
Lots of parking space around.
Great decor.
author: Aditya B.

description:
I came here for my birthday dinner and had a wonderful experience!  

I split a pear drink (I cannot remember the name or even what was in it), but I do remember that there were sliced pears both adorning the side of the glass and smushed in with the drink -exquisite!

I informed our server that I am a vegetarian, and the kitchen made me a beautiful vegetarian plate.  Although it was a while ago, I remember two very distinctive things.  One, that it was quite large.  Large enough, in fact, to take some home for lunch the next day!  And two, the curried carrots and large white beans were so very special.  I have never tasted a dish that blew my mind as much as Garibaldi's curried carrots did!

Although service was a little slow and spotty, our server was attentive when he was around, and did comp us an extra order of risotto cheese balls since they had mistaken our order and brought an extra one out!  I also tasted a bit of my friend's fried green tomatoes, thinking that I would fall in love with this dish since I like tomatoes, but sadly, it was the only part of the meal that was the least interesting.  I suppose I am just not a fried green tomato fan... and the batter was a little soggy... oops!

All in all, I had a wonderful birthday experience at Garibaldi's, and would come back again and again for the curried carrots (and whatever else the kitchen can come up with on a moments notice for a vegetarian diner)!
author: Pb J.

description: We had appetizers that were absolutely delicious!  the environment is comfortable and the service was excellent.
author: mi m.

description: Dinner last Monday at 6 was not a good experience at Garbaldis.  The entrees we ordered were not as described on the Menu. The rock shrimp pasta dish mentioned tomatoes and sounded like they would be lightly sautéed.  When the pasta arrived it had well cooked tomato sauce with lots of capers which were not even mentioned in the description. My friend ordered roast chicken also smothered in the same sauce. Again that was not the way it was described on the menu.  We split the Garbaldis salad which was very large and good but the walnuts were missing.   Overall not a good value or experience.
author: Ila H.

description: Love Garibaldi's! We've been going there for 10 years, and never get tired of the food. Their chef has a great sense for flavors, and the staff is always professional and friendly. You really can't go wrong with anything on their menu!!
author: Kelsey H.

description:
Came here again the other night and was happy to find that it's just as wonderful as I remembered.  What stands out most is its perfect service, (which is odd considering how great the food is). I just have always been surprised by how good the servers are at maintaining an attentive, yet unobtrusive approach. Love them. 

Looking back at my last review of Garibaldi's I realize I ordered the exact same items... so it could be this is a five-star restaurant ONLY if you order the grilled calamari and seared tuna. So either order those, or take a chance!
author: Zoey S.

description:
Came here last night with some friends.  It's been a while since I was here last--don't know why I waited so long to return.
What a great evening.  The food is wonderful. The service is top-notch.

We started with martinis that were nicley put together.

  We then shared a bottle of Pinot Noir,Olsen Ogden, Sonoma Coast 2007 $55.
We got lucky  as our server told us that any bottle of wine purchased was half-off last night.  It's a very nice wine--we all loved it.

I then moved on to the traditional caesar salad, garlic croutons, parmesan $9.50 / $14.50.  I love it when you can really enjoy the taste of a good quality parmesan cheese.

I had the grilled filet mignon, sautéed fingerling potatoes, onion confit, arugula, point reyes blue cheese, madeira $32.50 for my main dish.  Anytime I see Point Reyes blue cheese--I'm ordering it!
It was cooked perfectly.  

Our server, (Adam?) was amazing--so helpful and genuine.  He did a great job managing our table and making sure that each and every thing that was ordered was to our satisfaction.

We all finished with desserts that were shared. The sorbet was amazing but what really brought it all home was the Peach Upside Down Cake, tahitian vanilla gelato, bourbon~white pepper gastrique $9

Get out there and try this restaurant. 
P.S.
 You'll feel better if you dress up a bit too. I'm glad we did as everyone else was looking quite sporty.
author: Thomas D.

description:
Great food, pleasant space, eccentric crowd. Loud!

From the outside, you might think Garibaldi's is ideal for a quiet, romantic, candlelit dinner. Everything about the decor and location of the place would tell you so; but no. It's very much the neighborhood hang-out, and the atmosphere when we went in (Thursday, 8pm) was deafening. My companion summarized it perfectly: "people who should know to act better at a restaurant". 

The food was excellent. I had the watermelon and I-forget-what salad; very flavorful and well presented; followed by the bucatini con gamberi, which lived up to the promise of the appetizer. Wait staff did a good job, and were pleasantly accommodating.

Whether or not you'd enjoy the restaurant probably comes down to whether or not it's your kind of crowd. Without passing judgment, the atmosphere was one of the most homogenous I've been to for a restaurant, and we stood out a bit for not fitting the mold of being quinquagenarian, moneyed and white. The food really was great; you'll just enjoy it more if you were there in good spirits in a group of four than if you were looking for a mellow evening as a couple.
author: Mike D.

description:
Garibaldis is a restaurant I really wanted to love. But I'm sad to say, it failed to satisfy this critical bear.

First off, I want to say that Garibaldis looks very nice. The decor is very modern and the tables were set up comfortably. It's actually much bigger than I thought it would be and the hostess was very  nice.

The food itself was subpar. I came here with my lady bear where, with Yelp's expert advice, we started with pork belly and watermelon and fried risotto croquettes. We ended with chicken Milanese and rabbit pasta. Let me break it down...

Appetizers:

The bread that came was stale although the Olive dip was delicious. The Fried Risotto Croquettes have a great consistency, however, the tomato sauce undercuts its flavor. It basically tastes like fried macaroni and cheese at your local Cheesecake Factory, quite a shame. The pork belly and watermelon was appetizing in flavor, but the pork belly wasn't really crispy and it's actually REALLY hard to eat in a bit due to how slippery it is. Additionally, the watermelon also isn't very crunchy so the two textures don't mix well together. All in all, the appetizers were both forgettable.

Main Course:

The Chicken Milanese was basically $22 fried chicken and mashed potatoes. The sad thing is that the flavors aren't much better. I am probably committing a cardinal sin but the mashed potatoes also taste like they were instant mashed potatoes. the consistency is consistently bumpy and the butter taste isn't very fresh. Additionally the chicken itself was a bit dry and the fried crust doens't stick very well. All in all, it's not that delicious.

The rabbit pasta was far more disappointing. It's basically a pile of random stuff in a soup with pasta in it. The sauce just does not have the right consistency to be called a sauce. The pasta itself looks like tape worms. There are sausages, meats, and ham-like meats and I have no idea which one of them was rabbit (might be all three). The flavors are okay, but the addition of whole olives made the dish taste kind of cheap. 

Desert:

I had a berry sundae. Not much to see here.

Service:

I hardly saw my waiter. Actually I did, I saw him after I left, probably thanking me for actually giving him a tip despite the fact he didn't do anything.

In the end, I'm fairly disappointed in this restaurant. I wouldn't return again.
author: Scott L.

description: We were celebrating moving forward in a medical recovery and also the beginning of the holiday season, hence the ordering of initially a glass of champagne for each of us. We heard such good things about garabaldi's and the reviews were so amazing, we decided to celebrate at this destination. We ordered croquettes and they were lukewarm which was so disappointing because the reviews were great. The Caesar was smaller than we had anticipated and it was not anything special. Once again, another disappointment in our meal. The restaurant was not busy, lunch crowd meandering in. Our water glasses were not refilled for quite some time after we quenched our thirst. We ordered another glass of champagne each and the glasses were taken from our table, refilled and brought back. You would think that at $15.50 a glass, a new glass should have been brought each time. We ended up having 3 glasses of champagne each and I would have hoped they could have suggested purchasing the bottle instead of being charged per glass. We asked for bread and the first bread presentation looked just like the plate that another guest had sent back. The second bread presentation was quite different. The halibut and cannelini beans was not hot and mediocre in taste and presentation. For dessert we ordered the profiteroles and they were not worth having. The entire experience was definitely not what we had in mind. We will not be back. There is no reason for this lack luster service and food, especially when the restaurant was not busy. I am proud to be part of this hospitality industry for over 4 decades and am sad to see that being a part of the "front of the house" has become a lais affaire position with no accountability for professionalism.
author: Veronica L.

description: 100 dollars for 2 appetizers, 1 starter, 2 whiskeys, 2 beers? What?! The food was inedible.  I don't know what I expected... but room temperature, soggy cauliflower was not it!
author: Chelsea D.

description: Great take out lunch menu at $7 or $8. Food was terrific with great service. Would go back again.
author: mike t.

description: Recently ate here...overall experience was very good. The decor is clean and well maintained. Our waitress was very very friendly, personable and accommodating. The dishes we ordered were delicious as well....I splurged a bit, as I'm usually very strict with my nutrition, but I was famished after a heavy back workout a few hours earlier...I had a grilled chicken and faro salad, chicken liver pate and crispy herbed goat cheese...they were all SO good.
author: Michael K.

description:
Garibaldi's has turned a corner. We live in the neighborhood and have dined at Garibaldis a number of times.  My family of four went for dinner tonight and we were all hugely impressed at how much the place has changed -- for the better.  The service was impeccable with plenty of help refilling water glasses, serving food and being generally helpful. A major improvement over our past visits when dinner could take 90+ minutes due to horribly slow service. The food was absolutely outstanding with portions that were perfectly sized.  One could enjoy a salad or appetizer and a main dish without feeling over fed.  The meals were outstanding -- each delivering on the promise described on the menu.  They all offered just the right amount of flavor without trying too hard or over doing it.  We will definitely be back again and highly recommend Garibaldi's for a delicious night out with excellent service. 

We had the pasta, salmon and salmon sliders and would recommend all of them!!
author: CC C.

description: Overall great little gem tucked away in Presidio Heights. Albiance is great, service was solid, and each dish from the ceviche to calamari to the risotto were each well prepared and tasted excellent. Not as Italian as I was imagining going into the meal, more Americana. But overall strong recommend.
author: Sean H.

description: Well, our meal was very inconsistent. The roasted beet anti-pasti was excellent. The Monterey calamari was not to our taste - it was so fishy, and mushy, and just not as good as the fried style. Chef selection papardelle with pork ragu was right on. Perfectly tender pork and nice al dente noodles. The chicken Milanese was pretty gross and not sure why it's so popular. The breaking tasted like fish and the sauce was super sour from capers and lemon. Desserts were quite excellent, especially the caramel panna cotta. Not likely to go back unless someone is paying me to eat there.
author: david l.

description:
At dinner tonight,while eating our salads, our server Katie stepped between our table to take the order of the next table placing her behind/butt four inches from our plates. She left to place the others order and upon returning I called her over to request she not step in between tables on either side of us, she challenged my discomfort stating that she could only present to customers  in that manner facing them and giving others on either side of her, her rear end.

 We explained to her that the other servers were serving quite well without going between the table to the patrons dislike. The mere fact that she challenged a customer was discomforting and questionable. Next our food arrived...my husband ordered the Filet Mignon and I the Orecchiette, no one asked him to cut into his steak to see if it was as he ordered, nor did anyone return within the next 15 minutes to see if we were pleased with our selections. My entree lacked seasoning and my husband had to get the attention of Katie requesting some parmesan, pepper and a glass of wine...very poor customer service...and she never returned to check on use even though she was servicing both table on each side of our table.

 The table services person came over as my husband completed his meal and asked to take his plate and asked if I was completed with my meal or would I like to take mine to go. I replied "no" he asked if I liked the entree and I told him "no". After he left then our waitress Katie appeared (at the end of the meal, at least 45 minutes since the food had arrived) to say she was sorry about the meal and asked if I would like something else...which I replied 'NO'.  Yes, she took it off of our check, but the fact is I did not have any dinner because of such unbelievably poor service. To ask a customer if they would like something else at the end of what turned out to be a deplorable evening can only be yelped. The Disco Hotel made our reservations and this wonderful hotelier and others have a right to know of this situation.
author: Arbcus G.

description:
Returned for a family dinner here on a Saturday night.  This visit we tried the grilled calamari with butter beans - the aioli was delicious and creamy and I loved that they grilled the calamari instead of frying.  I also tried the grilled filet mignon and the chicken breast milanese which were both delicious.  

They have valet parking for $10 - worked out perfectly on this rainy night.  We took our time with dinner, dessert and chatting and didn't feel at all rushed.  The servers were quite attentive and we had a great time.
author: Janelle C.

description: Definitely a solid four.
author: Morris R.

description: I've been going to Garibaldi's probably once a year for the last 20 years, and every time I leave happy and try to remember to go back before another year goes by.  Garibaldi's is consistent.  Great food and great service, every time.  What I discovered tonight, however, is Garibaldi's very unpublicized happy hour, which will certainly bring me back any time I go the Vogue for an early movie (the theatre is located across the street).  Garibaldi's has the best happy hour in the city (who knew?)  from 5 to 6 pm only.  We enjoyed 4 cocktails, 1 burger (for him), a big plate of brussels sprouts and an order of risotto balls for $40.  ?? Can that be right?
author: Ana M.

description:
My department had our holiday lunch here.  I had the burger and it was huge!  The bun was buttery and toasted to perfection.   Each bite was delicious.   Others had the butternut squash risotto, which my co workers had really enjoyed.  The Garibaldi salad was also a hit but the chicken sandwich was a miss since it was bit dry.   

Service was efficient but the wait staff weren't too friendly.  They did their job but we could sense that they didn't really want to be there.

4 stars for the food, 3 stars for the wait staff = 3.5 stars overall
author: Veronica N.

description: We went here for thanksgiving and the service and ambiance was amazing. They gave us attention but didn't interrupt conversations. I would recommend this place to family for sure!
author: Josh W.

description: Food was good. We made a reservation for 8.30 PM. From the moment we arrived, to the moment we left, the service was poor and rushed. Our friendliness was met with the most fervent desire to close shop.
author: Vp G.

description:
I loved the bread and olive oil/olives served in the beginning of the dinner. The pork entree was very well seasoned, tender and juicy. 

Great service, very nice atmosphere.
author: Amir L.

description: They have a wonderful menu of apps, and we'd planned to enjoy them at the bar with cocktails before the movie at the nearby Vogue Theater. But the bar which consists of only 6 or 8 stools was already filled when we arrived at 530pm. Just wished they'd had a bigger bar because we often enjoy the bar vibe. My husband and I did order a wonderful selection of apps. I think they were 4 for $20. The Brussels sprouts were my fave.
author: Paula H.

description:
Garibaldi's makes an excellent chopped salad.  Their portions are huge, and some of the dishes totally inventive-others, like the bucatini, are only so-so.  

But their bathrooms are gross.  

Yo--management who reads these Yelp reviews like any manager should--clean your bathrooms.  No one wants to feel like they're on an airplane, especially not at $30 an entree.
author: Alanna C.

description:
two words, Chicken Milanse

Pure heaven!!! Great spot, great service. Good for dates or groups of up to 4.  Its our neighborhood spot. Good to go too.
author: Jon C.

description:
Great value happy hour, 7 days a week till 6:30pm. Good drink / food (appetizers/salads mostly) choices at half off!

As always grab a bite and drink here and head for a movie at The Vogue across the street!
author: Sumit C.

description:
