description: I love this place. I'm a transplanted New Yorker and this place has an Upper East Side kind of casual sophistication vibe.  I'm from the UES of NY,  so I'm biased.  Other's might not think this is a good thing!  The food is excellent, and the portions are very substantial.  Service has always been warm and professional.  I think this is what's called a "neighborhood gem".
author: Barbara M.

description: Great ambiance and food. Burrata and papas bravas quebradas appetizers were amazing, and the flavor combinations in the filet and my husband's lamb were terrific! Salted toffee pudding was just okay and our waiter seemed cranky. But other than that a great meal.
author: Christina C.

description:
the bf and I went to Garibaldi's on a sunday night after finding out that sociale is closed on sundays.  oops.

so we walk in, and go straight to the bar.  it's how we roll.  he gets a glass of wine, i order a diet coke, and we get down to business.  the menu.

and it's GOOD.  we  start ordering.  falafel.  awesome.  meatballs.  AMAZING.  asparagus salad.  lovely.  beet salad.  average.  typical beet salad, you know.  we split the lamb.  wow.  perfectly cooked, and they split it between two plates so we wouldn't have to drip all over their bar.  classy!

service was good.  friendly, the courses well timed.  the drinks were good, fresh juices used, great liquor selection.

we'll be back- but it's pricey, so not as frequently as i would like...
author: Alison R.

description: Fantastic food and excellent service.  Ate the "Taste of Italy" tasting menu (3 courses with braised short ribs as the main course) and then ordered some appetizers (duck rizze or something like that and risotto croquettes) and the rigatoni pasta.  Everything but the rigatoni were scrumptious.  The rigatoni was perfectly cooked, but my taste buds were not jumping like they did for the other dishes.  I'm definitely going back.
author: Ryan C.

description:
used to live around here and always considered it a somewhat stodgy place, but WOW, i was pleasantly surprised after my meal here tonight. 

get. the. lamb. other reviewers have said the same thing and seriously, you won't be disappointed. so tender, great middle eastern flavors.

bustling scene on a tuesday night and i'll definitely be back!
author: Ellie W.

description:
The food is definitely worth 4 stars, well-prepared and well-served.  I especially care for the salads and the Garibaldi salad with sweet, spiced pecans, gorgonzola cheese with a tasty vinegrette.

The crab quesadillas are amazingly good, served with guacamole and a salsa fresca.  I've enjoyed every seafood dish that I've had at Garibaldi's.
Little extras are also appreciated like coarse salt served in a tiny bowl as well as excellent bread and butter.

Service is normally fast and attentive, though at times a little inconsistent.  This isn't a party hangout.  It's a very good restaurant serving good food well.
author: Richard C.

description:
I'd been to the Garibaldi's in Oakland for lunch and had a stellar burger, so we tried the SF location for dinner last night. Our reservation was for 6:15, but we arrived early and sat and enjoyed a few cocktails beforehand. The four of us each got one of their specialty cocktails (with the exception of my Dad, who heaven forbid will stray from his pre-dinner Absolute-over.)  My favorite drink was actually my mom's blood-orange cosmo, which was not too sweet or syrupy but looked and tasted delicious. The margarita was simple but good too, served in a deep martini glass. Warm French bread and olive oil with chopped olives was served with our drinks, and might have been one of my favorite parts of the meal...rich, warm and pure Italian comfort food. 

Overall the service and timing was great, we wanted to take out time and they let us. We sat at a table in the back room which had nice lighting and less noise than the front of the house. They sat 4 or 5 other tables near us in the back room throughout our meal, although their chatter didn't interfere with our conversation. Dcor is sophisticated but comfortable--you can easily show up in jeans or dress clothes and feel appropriate either way.

My boy got the prix fix special menu that had a theme from Spain - endive and tuna confit and escarole salad, chicken and shrimp paella, and then a flan-like orange flavored dish with butter cookies for dessert. Good flavors and price ($30). My dad got the Petrole fish, which was buttery and delicious, probably my favorite dish. My mom got the pasta which was served in a giant plate/bowl, and seemed to be the backroom favorite as we saw 4 more pasta dishes being served while we ate. I tried the char, which I learned was a mix between trout and salmon. It was served with an apple cider glaze and apple shavings on top, and some spinachy greens and potatoes on the bottom. I was a little hesitant to try, since prefer sushi salmon over grilled, but the fish was a lot milder than salmon and went perfect with the apple cider glaze. Not sure if it's a regular dish on the menu, but I'd recommend along with the Petrole.  

Wine wise, we ordered the Samantha Starr Pinot Noir from Monterey. When I say "we" I really mean "I" because for some reason I'm usually handed the menu and given wine-ordering task. For all I know about wine, I could have thrown a dart at the menu and thought another bottle was just as good as ours, but for $42 a bottle this one really was--everyone seemed happy and since I took the wine ordering responsibility, I also welcomed the compliments on my grand refined taste and selection...any day! 

Just as she dropped off the check, our server also gave us complimentary shots of lemon cello, which was a perfect way to end the meal...and have an excuse to go home early and crash...that stuff is some tasty lemon-flavored fire water. With the taste of lemon cello and a feeling of food coma sinking in, it was a little like being in Italy again.
author: Kelly R.

description:
just got back from dinner here. it was de-lish! started with a small caesar, which was pretty big. nice and basic. and we got the pinenut meatballs to share also, it was soooo yummy. the meatballs were really tender and flavorful, but i liked the bits of pinenuts in the meatballs, added a bit of texture. the sauce it came with was really yummy too and i was tempted to dip my bread in it...but damn the lo-carb diets! 

for my entree i got the chicken milanese. omg, not only was it a huge portion, but it was just delicious. the chicken was tender and the sauce was flavorful. the breading on the outside was still crunchy. seriously though, you could easily share it between two people or take leftovers home for lunch the next day (mmm...can't wait for lunch tomorrow). i also tried my other two friend's halibut and scallops. the halibut was good, but i didn't love the salsa verde it came with. the scallops were really good, nice and meaty, slightly sweet. they were prepared really well too, caramelized on the outside but not overcooked. 

for dessert we got the chocolate budino which i thought was okay. it was nice cause it wasn't super heavy, but it was more sweet than chocolate-y for my taste. i ordered an end of the night coffee which i didn't feel was very hot, but the server was great and remembered to bring my milk instead of cream. 

service was attentive but not overbearing. she told us about the special cocktail of the evening which i got, but didn't really like. muddled strawberries, vodka, sugared rim...and i really like the interior of the restaurant. clean but not sterile, still felt cozy. overall had a great time and can't wait to go back.
author: Angela W.

description:
Went here on a date night and thought the food was great.  My girlfriend and I misjudged the days schedules and ended up making reservations for about an hour later than we should have.  When I sat down I was famished. Lucky for me the bread was fresh and came with an absolutely delicious Olive salad.  I'm a pretty big fan of Olive oil and Parmesan with  my bread, but this was amazing.
 As an appetizer we got the hummus dip, the only weak link in the chain.  The hummus came in a cup the size of a large shot glass and was served with a few pieces of garlic and butter toast.  The portion should have been bigger and I would have appreciated some veggies .  
 As entrees I ordered the Lamb Tenderloins.  While lamb is not something I frequently order, this rated in the top three lamb dishes I have ever order.  The green beans were outstanding and the couscous was a great base.
 My girlfriend ordered the tuna, which was again, delicious, but the star of the plate was the spaetzle. They were like buttery fried pillows, it rivaled some of the better gnocchi I've had in Italy.
 Definitely worth all 5 stars.
author: Fritz J.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place for years and finally made it here. We arrived at Garibaldi's at 8pm on a week-night...to find it completely packed...which in my book is always a good sign because a restaurant full of happy diners can't be wrong. Or at least that wrong.

As for ambiance: elegant and sophisticated Pac Heights neighborhood dining. Yes, the place can be a touch loud. And while I may not have completely enjoyed being so close to the next table that I could hear their awkward first online date "previous relationship" disclosures...(i.e. "you should probably know that I'm not only divorced, I've actually been divorced twice" - ouch), the food and service completely made up for the close proximity. 

Hummus appetizer. Yum. Duck Confit Salad. Yummy.  Pan seared sardines. Super Yum. So good in fact that my piglet of a dining companion claimed that I would get "half", but when he was finished with the starter and passed it to me, it was seriously more like a quarter. I really shouldn't complain, however, as he was treating me to dinner. Now back to the rest of the menu. The lamb is as fantastic as everyone says. Unbelievably so. And the filet mignon? Incredible. Best of all, it came with a Yukon Gold "tater tot" that tasted just like those hash browns you used to have at McDonald's as a kid - crispy and salty on the outside, melt in your mouth creamy potato interior - but much healthier for you (at least I hope). Top that all off with a fabulous bottle of cabernet  and we were set. By the end of the meal we were so stuffed we opted for liquid desserts and were also treated with some house made Limoncello. Highly recommended.
author: Suepattra M.

description: I am shocked to see that there were postivie reviews posted. Maybe I ate there on an "off night."  Here is what it was like. Staff good and professional, place looked fine, not too noisy, clean bathroom. Now to the food, i had asparagus lyonnaise- with a poached egg. Hard to mess it up, but the plate was prepared in an unappealing helter-skelter way and the dressing was overly strong. Then I had the lamb in tarragon sauce. Meat was rough (as in coarse not touch per se), curiously seasoned with a tarragon sauce that was way over the top, both quanity and tarragon (which i normally like and cook with a lot). Sauce was drowning lamb and it tasted burnt, texture was gummy/slimy. The whole mess was on top of the latest designer grain (tasteless), plus string beans mixed in their weird admizture of flavors. It was unappetizing to look at in every way imaginable. Really it was inedible and in fact i left 99% of it. Waiter did not ask if I preferred something else. Dessert was a very odd oatmeal icecream concoction that tasted of shoeleather and old socks, with strange gummy, grainy texture. Why why why ruin perfectly good ingredients by purposefully making dishes as odd as you can???
author: Robyn G.

description: I always would drive by here, say to myself I must try this restaurant, and forget about it until I drove by it again a few weeks later. FINALLY I came here with the boyfriend and friends and was very impressed. The service was terrific and I loved small intimate ambiance. I ordered the steak and the potatoes were melt in your mouth good. For an app. my boyfriend got the blue cheese stuffed dates. I was not super clear on whether i would even like them. I must say they were probably the highlight of the evening.  Well that and the Garibaldi's version of an irish coffee. Will absolutely be back.
author: Erin R.

description:
my wife's risotto reminded me of when i was single..and i would throw minute rice into a can of campbells tomato soup and let it boil forever.  not a chef's masterpiece

it is more a place to take your parents or grandparents when they are in town.  plenty of room in the back for walkers and canes.

id give the food 5 stars(minus the risotto), and the ambiance is a bit stuffy...and boring....yawn.  im getting sleepy writing about it.

be prepared for an expensive dinner in the presence of the neighborhood-types who cackle about the latest and greatest IPO.
author: Olis L.

description: On walking in to the restaurant, the place is pretty small. We went to the bar since our table was not ready and they have a nice cocktail menu. I had a blueberry mojito served by a very friendly bartender. It was tart like I like. I had the carrot soup which was really different and good. For dinner, I had the Alaskan Halibut for my entree. It was ok, nothing special. The spaetzle that came with it was also just ok, bland and not something I would order again. For dessert, we had the chocolate budino...WOW. That was really rich and yummy. Like a sophisticated brownie sundae. I would come back just for that!  The service was really good as well.
author: Leslie B E.

description: I've been multiple times and everytime, it's solid across the board, service, food , wine. Great local hood vibe. Usually requires reservations though unless you want to nosh at the bar which seems like it would be a good idea.
author: Sarah B.

description: Lovely elegant restaurant.  Went in for a late dinner last week and had wonderful meal-- my ravioli was fresh and flavorful. The staff was gracious enough not to rush us through our meal,  allowing us to linger over after dinner drinks long after everyone else had left.
author: shoba d.

description: I randomly went here with my parents last weekend, because it happened to be a block from their hotel.  I didn't have any expectations, but I was very pleasantly surprised.  My sister and I each ate half of an entree and then traded.  We had the trout with vanilla buerre blanc, pearl couscous and clams (yum), and the marinated lamb tenderloins with pistachio couscous (double yum!).  They were both very good but the lamb was my favorite.  I also had a pomegranate margarita which was very strong.  It was a little on the expensive side, but its perfect if you are looking for a nice meal in a quiet neighborhood.
author: Melissa G.

description:
Who should dine here:  People in the neighborhood that are looking for a fun upbeat environment.  Worth traveling across the city for once, but probably better places if you are an out of towner.
 
1 Star - Lacking/Turn Off
2 Stars - Needs Work, But fixable
3 Stars - Adequate
4 Stars - Near perfect, rough edge here or there
5 Stars - Can't get much Better
 
Ambience:  3.5 stars. Garibaldi's has a sleek/modern business casual feel, but the restaurant still maintains a very comfortable environment.  Can actually work for a date (although I would not really classify it as romantic) or business.  Nice bar when you walk in to enjoy a drink before dinner, but wouldn't recommend as a place to hang out or be seen with friends. 
 
Service: 2.5 Stars.  Don't let my 2.5 stars turn you off from going here, it is just that the service really isn't that great.  No extras, they come take your order, bring your food, pour your wine, and all with a smile.  However, I expect a little more interaction from an establishment like this, maybe some recommendations off the menu, a little background on the chefs approach/style, etc.  Everything in this category was very average, kind of what you would expect from a diner.  If you know what you like off the menu and wine list you will not be unhappy, but don't expect a lot of value add.  It could be that we had a new waitress, but still I would expect they would have someone helping that could fill in the blanks.
 
Food: 3 stars.  Apps were actually a little disappointing, the salads were a little plain and lacked any unique flavors.  They weren't bad, just didn't leave any impression.  We did have one good app, some toscana salami with pomegranate salad.  It was very tasty and flavor combination was really great, I was pleasantly surprised by this one.  However, it was teeny tiny, which I don't mind personally, but I know people that get really turned off by this.  Entrees, were better. The short ribs were good, not the best but very solid. They were cooked to perfection, and fell off the bone and melted in the mouth.  The beet risotto with goat cheese is great, and unique, definitely worth trying. I found it less rich than most risottos, but yet it was as satisfying and flavorful.  However, the highlight was the lamb tenderloin.  This had to be some of the best lamb I have tasted in a long time.  Perfectly cooked and not overshadowed by a thick sauce or too much seasoning.  Basically the Apps were a 2, the entrees a 4, hence my 3 for this category.
 
Wine: 3.5 stars.  I actually brought in my own wine, but I did take a very close look at the wine list.  Nearly four stars here, I felt they had a great variety at decent price points.   Strong for California selections, but also some decent choices from Southern France (Rhone valley, etc).  Corkage was a very fair $20.  I think what could make the list better would be to have some stuff with a little more age on it, that would be better drinking right now.  Most of the menu is newer vintages that could use 30min + decanting/air time.  If I were to go again I would probably not bring my own wine as I felt there were enough interesting items represented on their list to take a shot at.
 
Overall: 3.5 stars.  Garibaldi's is a really solid place, however what is keeping me back from a higher rating is fairly plain service and food I found a bit uninteresting or unimpressionable.  I guess the best way to put it is, I feel in no rush to eat there again, but plan on returning at some point.  If you live in Presidio Heights or nearby, its worth checking out, but you could be a bit disappointed if you make a trek from outside the city.
author: Scott P.

description: The two of us had the prix fix last time I was here.  The entree was a 1 1/4" cube of pork grizzle on top of fava beans.  The person who brought it to us made a comment that one was very hot, but the other was not, even though they were they same dish.  Mine had a haze to the sauce.  I made a comment about this to our server, and was dismissed rudely.  Later on showed that it was also spoiled. Never again.
author: Jim M.

description: Terrific service and food.  Atmosphere's a touch loud if you're going for a romantic dinner, but totally worth it.  :-)
author: Danielle B.

description:
If I was rating my delicious mango mojito I would go for 5 stars, too bad  I didn't just stop there.....
I attended a bday dinner with 5 others.  Food was very salty but okay (the filet actually was very good), wine selection is limited, and there is absolutely nothing spectacular when it comes to the service....yawn.

The really disappointing part was when we couldn't convince the unsuspecting bday boy to order dessert, the waitress put a candle in another persons dessert at the table instead.  It was fun watching him blow out his candle, looking totally confused and then forced to hand the dessert back to the person who ordered it.  Oh and did I mention the bill was over $400?  And you couldn't even put a scoop of ice cream in a bowl for the birthday boy?  Yes Miss Manager, I understand it is not your "policy" to give desserts for bdays, we weren't asking for much, just not to be embarassed.  Even an apology would have been nice instead of your defensive attitude.  
My family is in the restaurant business, and I know you can have the best meal in the world but without good service a customer may never come back.  However, with a decent meal and superior service, people will always return.  
Needless to say, we won't be coming back here.  
0 stars for service if I could 
3 stars for food (would be 4 if they lost some of the salt)
author: stacy h.

description: I really wanted to give this place a better rating, but I left feeling quite disappointed after my trip here. The menu looked great - and our cocktails were pretty fantastic, but sadly, that's where it ends. My appetizer was fine - nothing to write home about (I mean, how can you go wrong with burrata, tomatoes and crostini?). But my salmon was bad - all bad. Definitely overcooked, and the sauce it came with was not the right flavor for the fish...it was overly sweet and I could barely eat more than a few bites before feeling nauseous. For dessert we ordered sorbets - come to find out they had to substitute in a flavor as they were out of one - and it was the worst part of the meal. Both tasted like soap. It's SORBET. What restaurant can't nail SORBET??!!
author: S.J. B.

description:
Love this place....  Its my neighborhood hang out and always a pleasure.  Their happy hour is as good as it gets.  The menu at this time is outrageous!  The best little bites to go with wine.  
Just wish they had more barstools...  
Its comfortable and easy- the staff is helpful and kind.
author: Janelle L.

description: Always always great. Garibaldi's does not miss a beat from the cucumber gin martini to the fantastic chopped salad, and arctic char with fava, corn and peas? Boom You cannot go wrong here. Every bite was delicious. The Acme bread and olive tapenade were scrumptious. A winner.
author: Lisa P.

description: If there were 10 stars, this place would earn every single one of them. I took my parents (East Coasters visiting) to this place and we thought it was amazing. The atmosphere is exceptional; cozy and intimate, yet still cosmopolitan. The staff was so helpful, without being pushy, and she didn't sneer when I ordered the (only) $30 bottle of wine. The asparagus with pancetta was so good I almost didn't share with my boyfriend. The filet mignon almost caused me to pass out. The meat was so flavorful and decadent.  I would *highly* recommend it.
author: H H.

description:
last night's dinner at garibaldi's was the best i've had in san francisco.  of course, i've only been in the city for 9 months so maybe that doesn't mean much to you. 

it meant a lot to my mouth though.
author: Jason S.

description: The menu is always impeccable and seasonal, and the service professional, from host to server to sommelier to pastry chef. We've had so many great meals here, it's hard to even decide which dishes to mention. The fish is always one of the best dishes of the night, whatever the preparation or catch - salmon, bass, sole, whatever. I adore the broccolini - super salty and saucy with bits of pancetta. The risotto croquettes are unforgettable, all crispy on the outside and oozy and gooey on the inside. And the entrees have such attention to detail, even the sides are outstanding. And the desserts - mmmmmmm. They are very accommodating in the kitchen and are willing to make substitutions and omissions without even batting an eye. Even the pickiest and toughest to please have left happy when we've brought them to Garibaldi's.
author: Veronica L.

description: Just okay. A coworker and I had a working lunch here, and the food was decent (had the portobello sandwich), but our service was bad enough to make me not want to go back. We were basically ignored, and I have a low tolerance for such things. Especially in restaurants that look as nice and inviting as Garibaldi's....oh well. Nuttin special.
author: Beth T.

description: I second that this place is good, great in fact, but I felt just about 20 years too young to be dining here. Usually don't mind much about that, but for some reason it was particularly noticable here. The service was nice and the place is very Pac Heights. I like it, will definitely go back...just maybe when I grow up.
author: Lindsey B.

description:
The greatest part about work lunches is that you don't have to pay! I am so thrilled that Garibaldis is just two blocks from my work, making it a convenient 'work lunch place.' The atmosphere is very classy yet modern, good for a work lunch or an intimate date because it is quiet.

For my entree, I ordered the tropical salad with grilled prawns, pomelo, grapefruit, orange, mango, avocado, radicchio, citrus vinaigrette. My salad was beautiful- all the fruit was perfectly ripe and the juices blended nicely. A spoon would have been handy to sip the juices up with. I loved the texture/flavor combinations of avocado with shrimp and the fruits. It was refreshing and not heavy. My co-worker ordered the marinated lamb tenderloin salad, with pistachio couscous, tomatoes, green beans and field greens. I tasted it- it was wonderful. The lamb was tender and the pistachio flavor was strong but not overpowering. Highly recommend both these dishes.

Now, for the most important part- dessert (which I find, is hard to impress me with usually). We ordered the lemon Panna Cotta with fresh blueberries & shortbread cookies. Not usually a huge fan of this dish because it's not really dessert if it has fruit (too healthy!), but I thought it was okay- not too sweet, though it would have been nice to put blueberries at the bottom of the dish for a little surprise (gotta enjoy the seasonal fruite while it's ripe). The Chocolate Budino was delicious- warm gooey chocolate cake with espresso gelato, caramel sauce, topped with hazelnuts & almonds. Oh. My. God. This dessert SPOKE TO ME. Unfortunately, I had to be polite and share with my co-workers when all I really wanted to do was lick the bowl.  I mean seriously, can we just discuss the heavenly combination of chocolate, espresso, caramel and prailine? And the portion was generous. I hate when places act all pretentious with their 2 bite desserts- it's not an amuse bouche fools!!!

I love when places really get the basics right- the menu here is seasonal, modern, and delicous. The only problem was that our server was very, very slow- and it wasn't seemingly busy at all..... so I don't know what the deal was. Overall, I cannot wait to go back for dinner!
author: Laura D.

description: tend to forget about this wonderful place don't know why; one of the early adopters of Niman Ranch meats. Generally gorgeous flower arrangement and generally well trained servers. White tablecloths and warm lighting. Able to hear one another converse. Good wine list. Parking is a challenge unless park in the Presidio!!!. ...hummm maybe that's why.
author: miriam b.

description: It's...good. Yeah, the food was good and the service was on, but...Why offer a priced fixed menu that includes two qualified glasses of wine? Yep, half pours (So, apparently this is standard? I don't get it. $27.00 is not a magic number.) Anyway, my lamb was perfect, but the sauce a little thick. $165.00 per couple three hours later (drinks, salads, entres, wine by the glasses, and deserts split three ways), I left less than impressed.
author: David D.

description: Very mediocre.  The lamb was pretty good, the chicken was terrible. Oh, loved their chopped salad with broccoli and cauliflower. That was prob my favorite thing there but how difficult is it to make a chopped salad. Considering this is a sleek, swanky restaurant in Presidio heights, I expected better. Service was very average too. I think they do well because they have been around so long. My suggestion: in this economy, service and quality should really improve if they want to retain their well known status.
author: Wendi K.

description: I went here with my mom over parent's weekend. I was spoiled eating here; most of my meals came from under a heat lamp so I am not used to good food. This place was great. Eating cafeteria food the next day was unbearable.
author: Tom A.

description: Love Garibaldi's. The food is consistently good, the atmosphere is nice not to loud.  The waiters are very attentive.  For lunch they get you in and out, without feeling rushed.  I always have time for coffee or tea.  I prices are fair and everything smells and looks good.  If you get on their mailing list you get comped a free entree with a friend.  I will go back time and time again.
author: Susie S.

description: This restaurant is great, very good food, service, atmosphere.  Its in a nice little neighborhood with a theater right down the street, excellent spot for dinner and movie.  A friend and I split a couple of apps and shared a burger, it was all delicious.  I can't wait to go back try more of their dishes -- Highly recommended!
author: Sandy J.

description: This is a chain restaurant. There is another one in the east bay. Both are very nice. Food is consistently good and the service is excellent. If you live in the neighborhood then it is a place you would probably go often. If you live across town, then I'd say stay in your neck of the woods. Too many other restaurants that fit the same bill to drive across town.
author: Heather L.

description: We went to this resturant on a wednesday night and it was packed! although it was a little loud and our server was not on the top of his game...by any means...we still really enjoyed our meal. recommendations: crispy calamari app, risotto or pork loin entree. we really enjoyed the ambiance and atmosphere as well. great little neighborhood resturant.
author: Jenifer B.

description: Ate here recently and really liked it. The food was great - I had a fresh, tasty salad and a delicious fish entree. However, next time I eat here I'll likely be ordering the lamb: I tried a piece and it was incredibly flavorful. I liked the low-key atmosphere and dim lighting, and the fact that the restaurant was pretty quiet; it's always annoying to go to a restaurant so loud you can't hear your dinner companions. You won't have that problem here.
author: Jenny K.

description: We have been here a few times because we are new to the area and it is close and easy for us (still trying to discover new places) but each time our experience has been fantastic.  What brought me to review was we took our dear sweet friend here last Thursday for her birthday (it's her favorite restaurant having lived here for 20 something years) and once again it was just excellent.  The service, the food made for such a special evening for our friend.
author: Elsa S.

description: The food here was pretty good, pretty basic but not really special. Great lighting and atmosphere, very crowded but not difficult to have a conversation.
author: Carson H.

description: Definitely get the antipasto starter - cauliflower creme brulee, crostini and orzo w/ mussels were the best.  Nice atmosphere, intimate and chill.
author: Jean C.

description:
oh so good.

grilled chicken with melted brie and apple sandwich.

it's a nice and quiet place. perferct for a lunch date.
author: Rosalee C.

description:
My hubby and I have been enjoying our anniversary weekend since Wednesday and this is the third restaurant we have visited. Coming in from our first trip local Sonoma, we decided to find a place close to where we were staying in SF and came across Garibaldi's on yelp. This has to be by far the best meal we have had in the 3 days worth of quite expensive choices. The service was amazing, water refills every second, plate clearing, an extra nice waiter A++. The risotto croquettes were simply fried heaven with oozing cheese. We also had the gnocchi starter with no mushrooms. The gnocchi was soft but not too starchy and the sauce with tomatoes and peppers was just the right amount of spice. I had the halibut over a summer succotash with bread crumb salsa. The sauce was a bit tangy smelling, and i thought it wouldn't go well with the halibut, and I was surprised that it in no way overpowered my meal. My hubby had lamb and mashed potatoes, I stole some of the mash and it was yummy with the halibut. I would have preferred potatoes with my dish as well, but the summer salad was fresh and light. 
We ended off the meal with the chocolate budino, vanilla gelato instead of cappuccino, yum is all I can say. I was quite full at this point but enjoyed this dessert very much. I don't drink but the waiter brought my husband a little lemoncello on the house which smelled delightful and he enjoyed it very much. Great date location, yummy food, good service. 5 stars from me :).
author: Nicky K.

description: Absolutely delicious food, went with a friend for first time , i even got to talk to the chef who was very nice and hospitable, service is excellent too.A must try if ur in SF area.
author: rav m.

description: Had another great time last night.  I had the local rock cod and it was delicate and fresh.  My lady took the lamb as usual and loved it as usual.  The service was on point as always and the cocktails were creative and flavorful.  Dear Garebaldis, tell Sandra thanks for being exceptional.
author: Dan A.

description: Great food  and good atmosphere.  The prex fixe menu is a good value and the short ribs were right on the money!    was an ideal place to go before a show at the JCCSF.
author: TIM M.

description: I have lived in SF for a very long time now and last week was my first adventure to this fabled restaurant. Ok so its an italian restaurant right? What do i order? Thats right a burger and it was damn good! My friend had some fish and it was very tasty. I will be back to try more. The cozy atmosphere makes this a great place to frequent often.
author: Not M.

description:
So in the same vein as finding a restaurant to have your parents  take you out to on parents' weekend in college, I have found myself multiple times polling friends and coworkers for a solid, not too loud, having a good wine list, modern but not too trendy, nice but not outrageously expensive, restaurant.  I have collected many names but gone to few.  I don't know if it is because my boss first recommended garibaldi's, or because I don't like the name (no offense to those people named that) or because of its location, but I have never felt like going here.
But, since my parents were coming in from the east coast and so I didn't want to make them traipse around all edges of the city and were staying near the presidio, I thought I would give it a shot.
I have to say it is pretty expensive, and my green salad was a bunny-loving pile of greens that just wore me out, but I cannot stop thinking about the lamb.  It is their signature dish, apparently, and cooked perfectly these small tenderloins (I try not to think about how cute they once were) sitting atop pistachio couscous with a really good sauce that was somewhat au poivre without the poivre and with some haricots verts - it was actually surprisingly memorable and I would go back for that.  Oh and for the chocolate budino, of course.
author: Melissa B.

description: This place in in my neighborhood so my boyfriend and I decided to give it a try, we were very satisfied.  The Cesar salad was nothing special but we also had the chicken which was breaded served with mashed potatoes and a wine creamy sauce, I'm not a big fan of chicken but the chicken here rocks! we shared both things and had 1 glass of wine each, and it was all under $70 bucks including tip!  we will definetly be back.
author: Michele G.

description: This is my favorite neighborhood restaurant.  Love the food (the caesar salad, the chicken milanese, etc.), love the atmosphere.  We frequent this place about once a month if not more.  Great date place.
author: Ashley W.

description: Im a huge fan of Garibaldi's I hadn't been in many years and started going back just over a year ago. The food is terrific and this is probably one of the most consistent restaurants I go to.  The service is extremely professional.  Great, albeit brief, wine list.  Big pours of wine by the glass, which is always welcome.  My favorite is the chicken milanese, which IMHO is the best 'fried" chicken with mashed potatoes in the city.  Awesome neighborhood spot.
author: once u.

description:
update 7/27/07

oh damn.  my memory is really poor.  went here last night to check out the new chef and got....the lamb.  and thought to myself, "my this is awesome; i can't believe i've never had this before".  now, coming back to yelp to update my review (b/c the food was significantly better than previous visits), i see i am a moron.

anyway, the aforementioned lamb ($30; a generous portion of 3 large tenders, over cous cous.  didn't love the sauce and felt it maybe should be warm but still, really dug the dish overall) is v. good, and also enjoyed the risotto croquettes (not greasy, just creamy; 4 for $6) and the chopped salad ($10), which kinda looked like something on "semi homemade cooking" but tasted delicious and hurrah, was not overdressed...you really could taste the english peas, the favas.....

still love this very cozy bar.
author: Laurie A.

description:
my boyfriend and I had wanted to try this place for a year or so... always driving by and noticing it was packed. . . and the atmosphere is very much upscale presidio heights - modern urban chic, minus pretension. The food and service highly lived up to our already bright expectations. 
We were both enthusiastically pleased with our salads and entrees. I had the chicken with argula and garlic mashed potatoes in a lemon caper sauce... it was to die for!! I don't know about you -  but the pounded chicken breasts are yum, especially for a girl who always made her Dad cut the meat of the bones so she wouldn't get her hands dirty... 
I am truly a salad conoisseur and - this place has enticing variations for a salad starter - beyond the delish, but boring fruit, nut, cheese, meat, greens stereotypes.... 
The BF had a pork tenderloin with peaches, pancetta, and argula pesto.... again, to die for...  which is quite hard to come by with an accomplished foodie. 
the service was fab as well -- not annoying, but, intuitive and present. 
We will definitely keep this place in the rotation and you should too... Its Rockridge sister restaurant is also an alternative...
author: Ashleigh G.

description: Very charming neighborhood place. Great decor. Good selection of wines. We had several different Italian wines - Primitivo and Barbera D'Alba. Both were very good. Service was a bit slow  but very friendly and the food was delicious. I had a very tasty beet salad with chevre followed by best lamb I had in a very long time anywhere. I will definitely be back.
author: Alex k.

description: I had an amazing dinner here this past Sunday. Delicious (and dairy and chicken/beef-stock free) eggplant and mushroom soup as well as agnollotti with incredibly savory mushrooms and delicate black truffles atop. The antipasti plate hit all the bases, but my favorites were the risotto cakes, all warm and gooey inside. The chocolate bambino, with carmel sauce and espresso ice cream, sealed the deal (but made walking up the hill go a little slowly). Service here is impeccable, and even though the restaurant can get noisy (we had a very elderly couple next to us yelling at each other, due to hard of hearing, throughout the evening), it's still a treat!
author: Bee H.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurants in SF.  Upon my 2nd visit this past weekend, I had to yelp.  The food is simply delicious.  We started with the heirloom tomato and mozzarella salad (a bit skimpy on the moz!) and the gnocchi which was very yummy but rich -- could've just had one app.  Then we had the chicken which sounds generic but is a must have and the lamb tenderloin which rocks.  My only regret was that we were too full for desert!  Looking forward to bring my parents here when they come visit.
author: kim m.

description: I love this place... been probably 10 or 15 times over the last 12 years, and each time it's a home run. I like to eat at the bar and talk to Jack the bartender who schools me on all sorts of good wine and liquor.  I think Jack is as knowledgeable as it gets, and was generous in allowing me to taste a few different wines and liquors.  It's upscale, but it's never been pretentious when I've gone... great wait staff, great food.  I had the filet mignon last time I went in, fabulous.  Replaced the potato au gratin with french lentils... they were off the hook. Great seasoning. I wish the place was a bigger and the tables weren't quite so close together... but it's SF, so space isn't easy to find.  Go to Garibaldi's.
author: Phred P.

description:
Great food, great ambiance, adorable neighborhood.

Great place to chat with a small group of friends.

And get the dessert that's some type of praline flourless chocolate cake.
author: Ilana R.

description: Honestly, I had an amazing experience here when I took my family from out of town and my boyfriend. The ambiance is very modern and crisp and we all commented on the photography being really interesting and unique. Our server was really helpful and nice, though she was very busy. It was a full house! Our meal was DELICIOUS. Two of us had the Sole, two had the lamb...though the lamb was the winner, the sole would have been the front runner at any other restaurant. I would go back here again and definitely recommend it for a special evening. It is expensive.
author: Shannon C.

description: This restaurant has always been one of my neighborhood favs--good food, good portions, nice atmosphere.  Try out their pinapple martini, delicious lamb, and their bondino dessert is the BOMB!
author: Nancy H.

description:
A good solid 4 stars.

Nice atmosphere, great cocktails, perfect service, and some good food.

However, nothing about the food was truly outstanding or spectacular, so 4 stars is just right.  I'm not sure that I would make a pont of returining here unless it was simply a matter of convenience.  But if convenience arose, then I'm sure I could rely on the food to be acceptable.
author: Richard P.

description: The menu is short but what difference does that make when each selection is so good? The mushroom soup of the day was lovely and the marinated lamb with a special sauce and couscous was just outstanding. My husband, who doesn't like chicken breast, ordered the chicken Milanese anyway and loved it. The service was very good from beginning to end and the contemporary design of the setting is handsome. The space is noisy but other than that, it's a a great restaurant with a focus on the diners.
author: Lorinda S.

description:
I wanted to take my daughter out for her 28th birthday and decided to try Garibaldi's since I live so close.  All I can say is WOW.... not sure how I could have missed this place....

We arrived a bit early and had the choice to sit or go to the bar area but we were hungry so we will seated. The cast of characters from the hostess, server and bus staff were friendly and quite attentive. We started out with one of their house specialty drinks, the pear martini which was outstanding. Not to sweet and chilled properly. The warm olives and bread they serve were delicious ...very hard to stop eating!   KT had the roasted carrot soup with chive oil (really yummy)and I had the Caesar (my little way of testing the waters of a restaurant) which were just enough to wet our appetites.  The Chicken Milanese was perfect.... the delicate white wine and caper sauce with mashed pot's and arugula.... really yummy. KT had the Pork ragout with pappardelle which was also awesome.  The pappardelle tasted homemade and the sauce had a slight smokey flavor that added a nice layer of flavor.   Decent wine list and our waiter was quite helpful with the selection....

We both were so full but wanted just a bite of dessert which their menu offers... we had the cream puffs with slighly salted carmel  and chocolate budino.... just enough to put us over the top....they even wrote out happy birthday and added a candle for fun!

I would highly recommend this tried and true neighborhood place.... and we will go back again...soon!
author: Carol F.

description: I came here with my wife for our anniversary dinner (Yay for 4 years!) and was just delighted by the restaurant. The decor is modern and chic, which for better or worse is something that matters to us. Our waiter was very knowledgeable about the menu and made GREAT recommendations. We started with the Moroccan Melon. Basically this was some sort of melon with rose salt, saffron ice, and a whole bunch of yummy spices. A perfect light start to the meal. Since that melon was so surprisingly tasty, we decided to try another by ordering the watermelon and pork belly appetizer. This thing was amazing, like tears of joy good. Bursting with flavor though, so it's probably best for those with a large palate. For the entree, I took the waiter's recommendation and ordered the lamb. Again, it was stunningly good. We were told that this is the restaurant's specialty, and I would believe it. Perfectly marinated and cooked, it was among the best lamb I've ever had. I have completely forgotten what my wife ordered because I was wrapped up in the transcendent experience of that dish. Haha. So to sum it up, go to Garibaldi's, get the lamb, leaved a changed human being.
author: Erick W.

description: Great food and great service.  We usually sit at the bar and have a cocktail before ordering.  The bartender is welcoming and great at making their specialty drinks.  Food is simple but done sooo well.
author: Samantha G.

description:
Fabulous time.  It was warm inside the restaurant on a chilly night - I actually was able to sit comfortably without a jacket on.  SWEET!
The wine list was pretty extensive - there is something there for everybody.  Fortunately, they also have beer on tap for the non-winos. Our server was attentive to the fact that we are a couple who likes to order a few different things to start and confirmed what we'd be sharing a little bit in order to accommodate.  The tuna was good, the bruschetta was delicious, the Garibaldi salad contained a phenomenal combination of glazed walnuts, gorgonzola, and a vinaigrette that I actually loved.  The asparagus was DELISH - a tad salty tasting for whatever reason, but well balanced with other flavors.  We had the lamb and the fish- I never order lamb, but I tasted this and would consider it in the future.  It was THAT flavorful.  Desert was to die for.  Rhubarb and strawberry tart.  I can not believe the girls next to us were "too full" to finish the main course.  We cleaned all of our plates proudly, and will most likely return for a repeat performance!
author: Amie W.

description:
We ventured into the sleepy neighborhood of Laural/Presido Heights to share a meal at Garibaldi's with some friends.  The atmosphere is nice -- on the upscale side, but not snooty or stuffy.  The lighting -- lots of soft candlelight and dim lamps -- reminded us a bit of Plumpjack, and that comparison seemed appropriate to describe the crowd as well, which is on the older side.  Not a place you hit for that swinging happy hour, but very pleasant nonetheless.

Between the four of us, we had the soup of the day (a lentil number that was greatly enjoyed), the croquettes (quite yummy), and two salads.  I had the chopped salad, which was great -- full of several ingredients that don't typically make it into your normal first course mixed greens.  For mains, we had scallops with risotto cakes (excellent), moussaka, filet, and the lamb.  My husband had the lamb and proclaimed it spectacular, and everybody else adored their choices, too.  For dessert, we had the root beer float (tasty, but perhaps not great for sharing as we attempted to do) and the bread pudding.  Both great.

Service was attentive and friendly, but not imposing -- just like I prefer.  A drink mix-up, totally my fault, was quickly rectified as if the waitstaff were to blame.

I only wish this place was closer to our house.  I'm sure we'd be there often.  As it stands, I look forward to returning.

Bottom Line: an excellent meal in a sophisticated, but lowkey setting that will have you soon coming back for more.
author: L G.

description: This is such a beautiful restaurant, lighting is so flattering -- definitely go here on a date when you want to impress.  Service is impeccable and food is always perfect.
author: Amy D.

description: Best dinner I've had in years!!!!     The lamb is fantastic!!!
author: Ailish T.

description: The Chicken Milanese is awesome. Consistantly a great restaurant.
author: Mark S.

description: I was surprised at what an excellent restaurant this is as I thought it was just a "neighborhood" restaurant mainly to serve the residents of Pacific Heights.  Well, it was wonderful.  Each dish that our party of 6 ordered was original, delicious, beautifully presented.  Appetizers were hard to choose from, but uniformly excellent.  All entrees great:  I had the Halibut, which was out of this world.  And the Chocolate Bubino for dessert was top notch.  Friendly yet professional service also.  A bit noisy for me, but that is because everyone was having such a good time -- and my hearing is not great.  (At least no loud music thankfully, which is a complaint I have for MANY restaurant).  A wonderful evening with friends young and old.
author: Marc Ellen H.

description: Great experience.  Food is dependable and the service is good.  Drinks are fun too.
author: Janet L.

description: The food here is generally good however they threw us a few curveballs with the meal.  For instance my date had the short ribs and they served a rather small portion with a huge dollop of creme fraiche on top which wasn't mentioned on the menu.  Suffice to say my date felt this an unwelcome addition.  The petrale sole was tasty but was accompanied by brussel sprouts which was not mentioned on the menu - thankfully I like sprouts but know a lot of people who don't.  In short they should explain the dishes on the menu in more detail.  The service was excellent, from our waiter to the hostess/sommelier - very helpful, knowledgeable and friendly.  I do wish they could do something about the noise level as it can get awfully loud.
author: Lydia K.

description:
Very sexy, ultra chic and contemporary space that makes you feel like you're on the Upper East side of Manhattan.

Tony, well-heeled regulars from Presidio and Pac Heights - you can't go wrong here.  Great cocktails, varied menu to please carnivores and others alike.  

Start by asking your waiter to bring you some of the bar olives - homemade and marinated in herbs and garlic - sublime.  The best Caesar in town, but the most interesting starter is the ever-changing selection of 4 appetizers (I've had beet/orange salad, deep-fried risotto balls....)   The chicken milanese is comfort food gone upscale -served with capers and with mashed potatoes, it's enough to make a grown man cry.
author: Michaela S.

description: Fabulous dinner here, and not just because I didn't have to pay! Tried the taster menu with wine pairing and grabbed tastes of all the other dishes served to the rest of the party. Pepper sauce for the steak was a brave decision. Tasted separately, the steak was juicy, tender and flavorful,   the sauce was the essence of perfumed and spicy black pepper. I would have thought the one would overpower the other, but they combined wonderfully. The chicken and the lamb were as good as everyone else says and the 'little ear' pasta with sausage was a triumph of texture and taste. Didn't try the creative cocktails as that would have been pushing my luck with the host - I suppose 12 to 15 bucks per glass is normal in the city.
author: Tim K.

description: I lived 50 feet away for 3 years and always went there for special occasions and their brunch, which sadly only lasted for a short period of time. I wish I could have gone more often, but it is a little pricey, but worth every penny!!! Food was amazing every time.  Service was fabulous and great ambiance.  Always packed, but you don't feel crammed inside, however you need to make reservations. I can't wait to go back soon!
author: Laura G.

description: Went here on a recent Fri night with the BF and the food was really good.  The main problem is that the acoustics are so poor you cannot hear yourself think or talk.  It is sooooo loud it was unbelievable- seriously.  And the tables are so close together and everyone has to talk so loud that you are forced to listen to other people's conversation because you are almost sitting at the same table.  The people here are mostly upper crust Presidio/Pac Heights vapids who unfortunately have conversations about cleanses and colonics and the size of toddler son's penises right in front of their poor husbands who looked like they wanted to crawl under the table.
author: TravelBug W.

description: Great staff, freindly service and excellent food.  My only bummer is sometimes the smoke from the kitchen enters the main dining area.  Oh, and some of the patrons can be really full on themselves, but thats Laurel Heights for ya.
author: Jay B.

description: I have been coming to Garibaldi's since I worked for an interior designer on Sacramento Street during and right out of college in 1994. I liked it a lot. I moved from San Francisco about 3 years ago and could easily say I hadn't been to Garibaldi's in about 5 years. Last Saturday night 4 friends and I went for the Dine About Town and I could easily say we had the rudest waitress I've had in I don't even know how long. The moment we sat down she seemed to pounce on us to order a drink, and gave us absolutely no suggestions on the good bottles of wine below $65...(many of them were $100 and above). It's almost like she's used to her middle-aged older customers who sit and order whiskey on ice the moment they walked in the door. We all ordered the DAT special, which was $42 each and we ordered a few more glasses of wine after our bottle was depleted. I guess what I'm trying to say is that we weren't exactly cheap customers, our bill came out to be about $300. which was fine, but literally, our service was so rude, I would hesitate to come back too soon. The food was good, but not to die for in order to put up with classically-bad service... like the kind I'm talking about in some places in NYC or Europe. It's Garibaldi's, remember this people! It's a comfortable neighborhood restaurant that should be a nice place for locals to come back to. Maybe because we were all in our 30's rather than 60's they were rude... after we walked out, a friend we were with said that's how it would feel if they were racist... we were literally treated as though we were minorities. I tried to kill them with kindness, and I did at last get a smile from the waitress when we walked out... which was shocking.
author: Michelle H.

description: Very nice place to dine. Good service and wonderful food.
author: Anastassia G.

description: I usually go to Garibaldi's for business lunches as it's only two blocks from my office.  The decor and food are just my style -- clean, simple, and elegant.  The best part is the service.  So far, every time I've been to this place, it's been always pleasant and professional, which is hard to find even in other upscale restaurants.  Also, the other day, I stopped in, in the evening with my friend, Jacki to catch up over a drink.  Dan at the bar let us stay and didn't rush us at all, which made our evening.
author: J c.

description: we got to this place before the reservation and the wait staff was very kind to allow us to be seated early.  i had the chicken milanese, which was a ginormous dish with 2 slabs over mash.  the lamb is excellent too.  even the customary calamari appetizer was unconventional; the brusell sprout appetizer dish got me hooked on this veggie.  their IPAs were definitely a good touch.
author: John P.

description: I've been coming here for years and I can say with certainty that Garibaldi's never disappoints! The lamb is fantastic, the ambience is good. This place works for an intimate date or with a larger party - I've taken my wife and we've also brought our grandparents. Bottomline: food is fantastic!!!
author: Donald C.

description: This California Mediterranean restaurant is a nice enough experience for conversation and cocktails (they've also got a nice wine cellar), but as far as food goes, I was deeply disappointed.  For starters, I had the asparagus and pancetta with garlic, chili oil, and oyster sauce. While this sounds like a winning combination, the chefs somehow missed the cue on proportions: there was such an overwhelming amount of pancetta and oyster sauce that all I could taste was salt and salt. Even stuffing an entire asparagus spear in my mouth with one itty bitty piece of pancetta didn't alleviate the overwhelming saltiness of this dish. On the other hand, the grilled black mission figs, arugula, crispy pancetta, and goat cheese salad with port wine vinaigrette was a bigger improvement, and even quite good. In this dish, the pancetta played a more subtle role, letting the figs be the prominent presence with their caramelized taste and texture.   Read more at The Ballyhoo: http://www.ballyhoo.us/restaurants/review.cfm?review=23
author: Baochi N.

description: Get the massive fried breaded chicken with capers and arugula on a bed of mashed potatoes in a butter sauce (Chicken Milanese). Trust me! It's their signature dish and is amazing and they always have it on the menu for the lowest price. After dozens of flawless visits over the years, in my most recent visit, I was suprised to find that the salads were prepared poorly and the bread was not up to the excellent quality it sometimes can be (walnut and olive bread), but they did the chicken perfectly. The one bad thing about this place is that it is EXTREMLY loud and they seat most guests very close to others. If you end up next to even a moderately loud talker, you will have a hard time hearing what the person across the table is saying to you. Ask the waiter to seat you away from other guests if you want to talk (this won't be possible on busy weekend evenings)
author: C S.

description: We invited the whole family to dinner out at Garibaldi's for a special event, since this restaurant was:   a) close to the hospital, and b) one of our local favorites.  If I could have given a half star more, I would have for the food, which was tasty as always.  I'm writing since we had a party of seven, our server was guaranteed a 20% tip.  I have no problem with that, unless service is bad, and unfortunately for us it was. Our server was MIA most of the evening, we had to track him down, as in get up leave the table and find him (usually just hanging out by the hostess stand) to take our order for drinks, appetizers, dinner and then dessert.  Geez, we just would have appreciated the bare minimum of service, but we didn't even get that.  As for our special event, he made it clear he could have cared less. We told him we invited our family out to find out the gender of the baby together with them.  As in my husband and I didn't know, we had the hospital write it down on a piece of paper, seal it in an envelope which we would then open in front of everyone.  The champagne we ordered as we sat down, took 20 minutes to arrive, delaying the surprise event.  The guy seemed generally put out that we were even there.  What a way to put a damper on what should have been a special time.  Next time we'll select another restaurant...because there's lot's of good food in that part of the city.
author: Sue G.

description: Such a quaint restaurant in a neighborhood of great restaurants. We went there for the Dine About Town promotion on a Sunday night. The decor is very modern but comfy and the restaurant was bustling when we arrived. We were surprised to find out that they have a Sunday night Prix Fix Supper for $19.99! That Sunday's offering was a salad, fried chicken and a petite version of their chocolate dessert. We were shocked that it was cheaper than the Dine About Town, which offered one one selection: house salad, chicken milanese and a chocolate dessert. Unfortunately, by the time we were seated, which was around 7pm, they ran out of the house Prix Fix Supper and so the majority of us opted for something else on the menu. Everyone else opted to order the seafood linguini which they all finished!!!! I stuck to the Dine About Town to check it out. The salad was great, and my chicken was good. I was disappointed because when it came to dessert, the waiter forgot to order my dessert that came with the Dine About Town. He tried to rectify the situation by offering all of us dessert wines but I was bummed to be the last one to get dessert after everyone else was done. But the dessert was yummy nontheless. I would go back to try more items on the menu. I would just hope that they would offer more to their Dine About Town options!
author: Jess D.

description: To be quite honest, I can't tell you what I had to eat at Garibaldi's, or what our service was like, but I can tell you that I aged about 10 years that night---in part the fault of my date (I'm not giving any tedious details), and in part because of the fellow clientele at the restaurant.  Apparently, 20-somethings and Presidio Heights go together just about as well as poached quail eggs and steak tartare (which, come to think of it, were paired on the Garibaldi's menu).
author: Hannah J.

description: Nice neighborhood place.  The asparagus soup I had was good if a bit much and not as smooth as it could have been and needed salt.    The asparagus app was salty (and I like bacon).  The fries are thin and hot but they seem (to me at least) to have a batter taste which I don't like.  The ribeye was o.k., the chicken milanese is their speciality and is always on the menu.  Chicken breast (yawn) is very generous, coated in panko so it's crispy and served with soupy mashed potatoes.  The burger on focaccia is good.  Desserts are o.k. but not great.  The chocolate budino is always on the menu.  It's warm chocolate cake (and not like with a melting ganache center) but not quite done cake with coffee ice cream and nuts.  It should be shared as it's too large for one person.  Service is fine.  Reservations should probably be made.
author: danielle b.

description: a lot of dinner reviews, so i'd like to throw in my lunch assessment.  my older brother and i were seated at lunch-rush, no problem. i ordered the last of the dungeness crab salad, which was amazing (arugula, fresh crab, avocado, squash)...my brother had the truffle risotto which was among the best risotto i've had.  strawberry lemonade was okay, nothing  special.  they forget to bring my brother's soup, and also delayed on getting our drinks to the table. hence the docked star.
author: lily k.

description: Excellent food, great service.  We had a Friday night 7pm reservation and sat in a back booth with our 13 month old son, another couple, and a 9 year old boy.  Both kids were quiet and yet fun, and no one gave us any dirty looks.  In fact, we had a lot of compliments as we left.  So, although I don't know if kids would be ideal in the front room, it worked out really well for us in the back room.  A great dinner with friends - thank you Garibaldi's!
author: Katy R.

description: I love the Chop Salad and Turkey Bacon Club! It is the main reason I go here... the other reasons? Fun bar, diverse menu and overall good experience each time.
author: Kristen R.

description: I give 5 stars to affordable special occasion restaurants with excellent food. I have only handed out 5 stars to 2 restaurants....Garibaldi's & the Cottonwood in Truckee. Good eats, good service, & well worthy of a bday dinner etc. Ask for a table in the front room....back room isn't great. good people watching w/ food that is equally as good.
author: S M.

description: Perfect date spot: intimate, quiet, valet, good wine list, great food. I had one of my favorite fish dishes of all time here: Chilean sea bass with brussel sprouts. It was scrumptious.
author: Lauren D.

description: Wow. I drive by this place all the time and we decided to go for the dine about town prix fixe last week. I was a little hesitant about ordering a chicken breast at a restaurant (seems pretty boring) but it was probably the best I have ever had...it tasted just like my favorite German dish wiener schnitzel.  Their desert and chopped salad were also great. I will for sure be hitting this place up next time we go out for a fancy dinner and try some of the other items on the menu.
author: J. B.

description: Wonderful food, the lamb in particular was awesome.  Tried 4 different dishes with friends and everyone was very impressed.  Great service.   Can't wait to go back.
author: Marc L.

description: I took my family here because it is so close to where I live and we had no idea we were in for such a treat.  We sampled the fig appetizer and risotto roll, both are unique and tasty.  The salads were very  fresh. Everyone tried a different entree and I am not kidding when I say everything was delicious.  In fact I am not sure which one I would rate above the other, they were all so good.  I would definitely recommend this place!
author: Katie L.

description: We have been here just a couple of times over the years.  Good food, but kind of loud for us.  But this past week we discovered something FABULOUS about Garibaldi's... order cheeseburgers to pick up!  We were famished, too tired to get dressed to go out and facing an empty refrigerator.  Suddenly I remembered someone telling me that Garibaldis makes hamburgers to go for people who work in the neighborhood.  Bam!  I called, spoke with a busy but really nice hostess, placed an order and it was ready 20 minutes later.  So in 30 minutes, we were munching happily, watching TV with slippers on!  So as the rain and dark nights begin to get to you, put Garibaldis on the list for pick-up!  And they are such nice people there!!!!!!
author: Joan O.

description: wine was excellent. i really liked the risotto croquettes. i went here for a company dinner
author: hugh k.

description: Wow... Garibaldi's has inspired me to join and write my very first Yelp review... what a fabulous experience!  We wandered in around 6:30 for cocktails before our 7 o'clock reso.  I had a cactus blossom - tequila, lychee liquer and grapefruit (fresh squeezed at the bar), and it was a little bit of heaven.  My boyfriend had the salty dog (without the salt) - another fresh-squeezed grapefruit drink.  Delicious. For dinner, we'd brought our own wine, and didn't get any of the attitude I always fear when we BYOB.  In fact, the server was curious about the bottle, and when she opened it, commented on the eucalyptus that she could smell on the nose.  For a starter, we ordered the soup of the evening - a roasted corn bisque - and the risotto croquettes.  The soup came in two bowls so we could share, and was absolutely delicious.  The croquettes were amazing, melty cheese oozing out the middle.  For dinner, a perfectly cooked filet with al dente vegetables and a "tater tot" for the BF, and lamb tenderloins with couscous and the most delectable cream-based tarragon sauce for me.  Too full for dessert -  instead, we were served complimentary house-made limocellos.  When the bill came, we hadn't been charged for corkage - bonus!  Only word of advice - the restaurant gets pretty warm, wear layers you can peel off as your belly gets full.
author: Jenny B.
